story:
The ELECTRICMOOD revolution

We wanted to ride a portable transportation foldable device that would be, at the same time, light, powerful, silent, beautiful, safe, fun and comfortable to use... After 4 years of development and test, an incredible technology made this dream come true.

Now, the ELECTRICMOOD is the greatest scooter ever. Thanks to a new direct drive brushless engine system, we can achieve a weight as low as 22 lbs (10 kg) together with great features:

  • 12" inflatable tires
  • Front and rear disk brakes
  • 500W engine
  • Rechargeable lithium battery
  • Fast charger
  • Front and rear LED headlights
  • Quick and convenient folding system

Our scooter provides an extended range to your lifestyle. It can be used instead of or together with public transports to reach your destination with fun. You can charge it everywhere, and save time.

  • 12 miles autonomy
  • Top speed limited to 16 mph by software
  • Maximum charge time of 1 hour
  • Very small footprint when folded: 37" x 22" x 8" (925 mm x 570 mm x 205 mm)


A great design



The design imagined by eliumstudio is splendid.

All the functionalities are smoothly integrated in pure shapes that work perfectly together. The slick aspect of the scooter makes it easy to fit at work or at home.  And ELECTRICMOOD riders look cool!

A great engine

The ELECTRICMOOD couldn't be so light without this innovative engine. It is an axial flux direct drive brushless engine completely developed in-house. This patented engine provides a high level of integration, a great power density and highly reduced weight. It is also very efficient while freewheeling providing a lower power consumption and enabling a "push" scooter usage.


An incredible riding experience

It feels like floating over an air cushion...

  • The 12'' tires provide stability and an efficient absorption of the road bumps 
  • The disk breaks give you plenty of breaking power to stop your ride
  • The mudguards keep you dry when the road is wet

The ELECTRICMOOD turns the burden of transportation into a fun and enjoyable activity.

Because the engine provides very little friction, you can also use it as a push scooter, increasing the range to virtually infinity!

A smart folding system

The folding system makes the ELECTRICMOOD very compact. When folded it fits in a 37" x 22" x 8" volume. You can lay it horizontally under your desk while charging at work, or vertically close to a power outlet in a bar. Thanks to the integrated charger your ELECTRICMOOD can recharge anywhere, anytime.

And it rolls !


With two tiny wheels arranged on the chassis, the ELECTRICMOOD can be moved around like a small suitecase.

In the press

Test on a TV show


About us

Our team is made up of engineers and electric scooter enthusiasts. We are base in Paris, France and we enjoy our urban lifestyle. 

We love to use our ELECTRICMOOD for our daily activities, and we can't wait to share this experience with you!


Please, feel free to ask any questions at contact@electricmood.com

story:
Short Summary

Throughout the years of living in different places, I always struggled with keeping my shower organized. My husband Jesse always complained about all the products I would store in our shower and recommended I stored them outside in a cabinet and when I was to shower, to bring them in with me, but I knew I would forget. Just when i thought I had found the perfect product that would bring the solution to my problem, I realized it had only made it worse. Every shower caddy I would buy would end up rusty or falling apart due to the weight of the bottles. I would end my shower with a bruised toe, picking up all the bottles and repairing the caddy. 

I wanted to contribute to everyone who shared the same frustration as me by creating a product that was strong, durable and elegant.

The Shower Bench Drawer will give every homeowner a unique space of storage, keeping their products private and hidden from everyone else. What you can store inside the bench drawer is endless. The drawer is very easy to clean, it is made from a material that is mold and mildew free. 

I am confident that with your contribution, the Shower Bench Drawer can be in every shower and on the shelves of every home improvement store.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to invest in better tooling. All of our prototypes have been made by thermoforming molds and we are now working on injection molding for a better product. With your support you will help us with the first batch of mass production. 

Our perks are our way of saying thanks. You will be rewarded for your help by receiving the only product to be built inside the shower bench. The Shower Bench Drawer will give your shower a touch of luxury and it will be organized at all times.

Other Ways You Can Help

If this isn't a good time to contribute monetary, please help by spreading the word with your family, colleagues, and friends.

Use the Indiegogo share tools to turn your friends and family on to this cool new product and better way of product organization inside the shower.

story:
Site disponible au Québec seulement // Website available only in Quebec

**ENGLISH  BELOW**

Qu'est-ce que BubbleGrid.com? C'est un réseau qui met en relation les gens qui ont des biens ou des services à offrir avec des gens qui souhaitent réduire leur facture ou leur surconsommation. Nous profitons de la croissance de l'économie de partage pour permettre l'échange entre utilisateurs qui ne sont pas toujours des entreprises, mais souvent des particuliers.

En mars 2015, deux entrepreneurs, Alexandre Lizotte et Benjamin Couillard, ont élaboré une idée audacieuse. Construire une application qui permet un meilleur partage des ressources. Par contre, un obstacle parmi tant d'autres se dressa devant eux, car ces deux étudiants en administration des affaires n'ont:

1) Aucune connaissance en programmation;

2) Aucun budget pour faire affaires avec un programmeur. 

Ils ont donc décidé d'apprendre eux mêmes à programmer. Cours en ligne, livres, articles... les recherches commencent. Neuf mois plus tard, après de longues heures de travail, leur vision devient réalité. Ils savent programmer et  BubbleGrid est enfin prêt au lancement. 

"BubbleGrid relie les ressources existantes et disponibles en tout genre. C'est à travers le partage de ces ressources que nous pouvons minimiser les effets de production et consommation de masse. BubbleGrid est un outil accessible, qui nous permet de relier partage, écologie et productivité. Un outil logique et avantageux pour tous."

Visitez notre site web: bubblegrid.com


BubbleGrid.com is an online network that puts into relation people with goods to rent or services to offer with people that demand a cheaper way of consuming. We take advantage of the sharing economy by using user to user transactions, not always business to user.

In March 2015, two entrepreneurs, Benjamin Couillard and Alexandre Lizotte, have an ambitious idea. Build an application that allows a better sharing of ressources. The problem is these two students in business administration have:

1) No knowledge in programming;

2) No budget to hire a programmer.

So they decide to program the thing themselves. Online classes, books, articles...the learning starts. Nine months later, after long hours of work, their  vision becomes a reality: they know how to program and BubbleGrid is ready to launch.  

"BubbleGrid connects existing and available resources of all kinds together. It is through the sharing of resources, whether products or services that we can minimise the effects of mass production and mass consumption. BubbleGrid is an accesible tool which allows us to connect sharing, ecology and productivity. It's common sense and advantageous for all of us."

Visit our website: bubblegrid.com/english/

story:
Short Summary

We are a group of bike lovers in and around Somerville, MA. This holiday season, we're teaming up to bike for a purpose: to bring holiday cheer to homeless and underprivileged children in Somerville.

The Somerville Sleigh Ride

On the evening of Tuesday, December 18th, we are hosting a holiday-themed charity ride through the streets of Somerville. Suggested donation for the ride is $10-$20 (no one turned away).

We will bike through the streets of Somerville dressed up as elves, reindeer, etc, with a pedicab sleigh, and Santa! We're going to have a lot of fun. There will be caroling throughout the city.

And with the funds raised here on indiegogo and through participants of the ride, we will purchase gifts for homeless and underprivileged children, our neighbors, right here in Somerville. 

We're hoping to provide for as many as 30 kids this year. (30 x 20 = 600!) Your contributions will make this possible. We simply couldn't do this without your help.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise a minimum of $200 for our first Sleigh Ride to be a success. But we want to hit this one out of the ballpark. 

The more money we raise, the more kids we can provide for, and the quality of gifts will increase, too. Every little bit counts.

And any and all extra funds raised will go directly to the Somerville Homeless Coalition. 

You will get an email update from us after the ride with photos, but more importantly, you'll get the satisfaction of helping children in need. 

The Impact

We are helping to bring smiles, toy trucks, footie pajamas, fuzzy slippers, etc., to kids in need in our neighborhood! What could be better than that?

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word about the ride! 

If you're in the Boston area, join us on Tuesday, December 18th, from 6-9pm. (RSVP to the Facebook event, here or follow us on Twitter.)

Many thanks to you, and Happy Holidays!

-The Lead Elves of the Somerville Sleigh Ride

story:
Introducing: Trac-Top™

It happens all the time, right?  The weather is beautiful, you and your Jeep are ready to explore the great outdoors, and it never fails - you take the top off... and it rains!  One thing Jeep lovers know all too well is that when you take your top off, you are making a commitment.  Maybe there's going to be rain in the next few days, maybe it's going to end up being a lot hotter than expected.  Either way, you are either stuck with the top off, or stuck putting a whole lot of time AND energy to put the top back on. 

With Trac-Top, you get the best of both worlds. Our patented design is simple: in a single motion, you can engage or disengage the top, retracting from the drivers seat or from the passenger seats. However much sun or shade you want is totally up to you. Everything installs using stock hardware and mounts, and you get protection from almost anything nature throws at you. Fire-resistant, non-toxic, and tear-resistant, the material used to create Trac-Top; will keep your seats dry and cool while still allowing you to enjoy nature.

The designs are done and we are getting ready to go into production.  Right now, we need your help.  We are looking to raise $25,000. These funds will help provide additional inventory when we get to manufacturing.  As a thank-you, we are offering Trac-Top at a major discount to you, our valued contributors.

TRAC-TOP FEATURES:

  • Direct replacement for the freedom panels
  • No more struggling to remove heavy bulky hard tops
  • Instant protection from the elements when you need it
  • Open air driving when you want it
  • Peace of mind for you and your passengers
  • Compatible with roof racks
  • Water-resistant

Other ways you can help. 

 In addition to contributing monetarily, you can help out by sharing our campaign with trail buddies and your local Jeep groups.  Go ahead and post the campaign link on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram,  and any other social media platforms you use! The more people that are  aware of what we are doing with Trac-Top, the smoother the next few  months will go for us. We appreciate your contributions, monetary and  non-monetary, and thank you for your time. 

 

Risks and challenges

When you are creating something that people will be using in conjunction with their vehicles, you need to be sure that everything works exactly as intended. We have gone to extreme lengths in order to ensure the safety of Trac-Top. We have the utmost confidence in its design and in our manufacturing team. You can rest assure that any challenges that may arise between now and the time that we deliver Trac-Top to you, we will be sure to face them intelligently and boldly

We promise...

  • To update you.
  • To listen to your input and feedback.
  • To make addressing questions or concerns a priority from the campaign stage through delivery to your door.
  • To provide you with exceptional customer service.
  • To ensure you become a part of our long-term Jeep loving family!

story:
*español abajo 

The SoulFire Project

An Artistically Self-Sustainable Mobile Community

MISSION:

The SoulFire Project has two objectives: First, to live in a sustainable way within our mobile community, as well as with nature, the people and the communities we meet along the journey; Second, to use art and eco-techniques to promote and grow this movement towards a more sustainable future.

SHORT HISTORY:

In late 2008, my best friend Przemek and I (Cooper) started to convert our 1979 Crown Supercoach school bus into a mobile home/workshop/studio. Using many recycled and reclaimed building materials, and with the help and support of family and many friends, we converted the interior. We built and installed eight bunk beds, a kitchen, a wood stove, a "living room", and shelving. Through a lot of research and a huge learning curve of trial and error, we successfully converted the engine to run on waste vegetable oil. After a year of hard work, mistakes, and learning, we gathered our tools, our musical instruments, our faith, five good friends, and hit the road south.

Since leaving Oregon in November 2009, The SoulFire Project has travelled over 20,000 miles on waste vegetable oil. More than 100 artists, musicians, builders, engineers, and filmmakers from all over the world have shared various parts of this journey through the western United States, the majority of Mexico, Guatemala, and Belize.

OUR WORK:

We use the bus as a model to promote sustainable systems, demonstrating concrete solutions to many problems that we all face today. The bus runs 98 percent of the time on waste vegetable oil, almost eliminating our dependency on fossil fuels and reusing “waste” that can contaminate water sources while drastically reducing our carbon footprint. All of our electricity is solar-powered, eliminating our dependence on coal, hydro-electric or nuclear power. When possible, we catch and filter rainwater for drinking and washing. We wash our clothes with our bicycle-powered washing machine, getting exercise while saving electricity. We convert 90 percent of our “garbage” into compost and building materials (Eco-Bricks), which we save and give to projects that have land on which to build with them. Everywhere we go, we promote these kinds of “Eco-Techniques” through physical or virtual manuals and workshops.

WORKSHOPS:

-Vegetable Oil Conversion @ Klimaforum, COP16 Puerto Morelos, Quintana Roo, Mexico and the World Social Forum, Mexico City, Mexico.

- Recycling and Composting in middle schools/universities in Rio Dulce, Guatemala and at the town fair in Maria Lombardo, Oaxaca, Mexico.

- Music at Pinguinos Elementary School, San Cristobal de las Casas, Chiapas, Mexico

FORUMS & FESTIVALS:

-  Infrastructure, live sound, and concert @ Viva la Milpa, Oaxaca City, Oaxaca, Mexico

-  Construction of infrastructure (community kitchen, plumbing, showers, and hand-washing stations) @ Klimaforum, COP16 Puerto Morelos, Quintana Roo, Mexico

-  Live sound, transportation and logistics @ Coctel de Femme, San Cristobal de las Casas, Chiapas, Mexico

We have worked with organizations and communities on permaculture, bio-building and appropriated technology projects such as bicycle machines (Jaguar de Madera), solar power installations (La Ventana), super adobe, Eco-Brick and Earthship constructions.

MUSIC:

-  We’ve recorded three original albums on this journey (El Primer Paso, Le Grand Voyage & YouRevolución), with musical styles ranging from folk to reggae and from electric Balkan to cumbia.

-  We have done fundraising & awareness concerts for art/cultural centers and for people in need.  (El Paliacate, EDELO, Aldea Organica)

-  We have recorded demos and live albums for other artists (Kaguairán, Las Hermanas Sista, and Dr. Nativo y Los Warriorcandela)

-  We have played concerts at festivals, in plazas, in the streets, and in schools.

MINI-DOCUMENTARIES/VIDEOS:

-  Primeros Pasos, Six promotional/mini-documentary videos about Primeros Pasos, a non-profit clinic that offers free medical services to communities surrounding Quetzaltenango, Guatemala

- The Bicycle Washing Machine, Video exploring the construction of a bicycle-powered washing machine (built at Jaguar de Madera)

-  Permacultores, Mini-documentary about,"El Jaguar de Madera" a permaculture/bio-building center in San Cristobal de las Casas, Chiapas, Mexico

-  Blood, Sweat and Gun Powder, A poetic promotional video for,"El Paliacate" a cultural center in San Cristobal de las Casas, Chiapas, Mexico

-  Panaderia Los Sueños, Two promotional videos for, "The Dream Bakery" a bakery dedicated to helping at-risk teens in San Cristobal de las Casas, Chiapas, Mexico

TODAY:

Right now we are in Quetzaltenango, Guatemala where we have just finished making six mini-documentary/promotional videos for the “Primeros Pasos” clinic. We are now gathering a diverse bank of local organic seeds to start the SoulFire Seed Bank, organizing a music festival to showcase local bands and will soon be starting two different bicycle-machine projects. After this, the plan is to continue south, through Central America and to Brazil - to continue growing this network and sharing and promoting these tools for change with all the people who are ready and open to the knowledge we have to share.

WHAT WE NEED:

Right now our bus in a condition that makes it impossible to continue south. To keep this project moving, we need to raise $9,000 to complete the maintenance overhaul on our beloved bus:

-  Full transmission service, seal replacement and 11-quart gear oil change = $1,400

-  Oil pump service & seal replacement on pump and pan + 6 gallon motor oil change. ($100 in seals, $160 in motor oil + 6.5 hrs labor) = $910

-  Air system & air dryer service + replacement cartridge = $550

-  Air compressor service ($500) OR replacement ($960)

-  Steering & driveshaft linkage greasing ($60 grease + 1.5 hrs labor) = $110

-  Oil and fuel filters replaced (filters + 1.5 hrs labor) = $200

-  Differential service & oil change (14 quarts 50w gear lube + 3 hr labor) = $680

-  Hub/wheel bearing service & oil change (replacement wheel bearings, seals & 2 quarts 50w gear lube + 3 hrs labor per side) = $1,200

-  Spare tire (mounted on rim) = $700

- New DPF (Diesel Particulate Filter) = $780

-  “Running the Rack” (typical Detroit Diesel engine tune-up) 6-10 hrs labor = $1,000-1,600 (depending on whether motor needs new injector rocker arms & injectors.)

If we surpass our goal for this maintenance overhaul OR have anything left over, know that it will be put to good use. Our “Toolbox” is a wish list of things that could help us out a lot.

SoulFire Project “Toolbox”

-  (4) Heavy duty jack stands to help save the life of our leaf springs.

-  (2) 100w 12v solar panels to be able to use our solar system to do projections, concerts and construction with power tools.

-  (1) Projector to be able to host open air theater nights, projecting our own and others’ short films, documentaries, and movies directly from the bus!

WHAT YOU’LL GET WITH YOUR CONTRIBUTION:

We have many great and unique gifts, from original SoulFire Project albums...

to hand-screened SoulFire t-shirts...

to an all-inclusive one week stay on the SoulFire Bus!

Even if you can't contribute financially, just spreading the word to everyone you know is just as valuable! Please share our Indiegogo profile on Facebook, Twitter, or by good old fashioned email! Thank you in advance for your help. You truly have no idea how much this will be appreciated.

THANK YOU!!!

To know more about the SoulFire Project, you can check us out at our website: www.soulfireproject.wix.com/soulfireproject

OR Facebook: www.facebook.com/soulfireproject


----------------------------------------        EN ESPAÑOL        -----------------------------------------


El Proyecto SoulFire

Una Comunidad Móvil Arte-Auto-Sustentable

MISIÓN:

El Proyecto SoulFire tiene dos objetivos: En primer lugar, de vivir de manera sustentable, tanto dentro de nuestra comunidad móvil, como con la naturaleza, la gente y las comunidades que vamos conociendo; En segundo lugar, de usar el arte y técnicas de auto-sustentabilidad para promover y hacer crecer este movimiento hacia un futuro más sustentable.

BREVE HISTORIA:

A finales de 2008, mi mejor amigo, Przemek y yo (Cooper) empezamos a convertir nuestra Crown SuperCoach, un autobús escolar de 1979, en una casa móvil/taller/estudio. Utilizando muchos materiales de construcción reciclados y con la ayuda y el apoyo de la familia y muchos amigos, convertimos el interior. Construimos e instalamos ocho camarotes, una cocina, una estufa de leña, una "sala", y repisas. A través de un gran trabajo de investigación y una enorme curva de aprendizaje de ensayo y error, logramos de convertir el motor para funcionar con aceite vegetal usado. Después de un año de duro trabajo, juntamos nuestras herramientas, nuestros instrumentos musicales, nuestra fe, cinco buenos amigos, y empezamos este camino hacia al sur.

Desde que salió de Oregon en noviembre de 2009, el Proyecto SoulFire ha recorrido más de 20.000 millas con el aceite vegetal usado. Más de 100 artistas, músicos, constructores, ingenieros y cineastas de diferentes paises han compartido diversas partes de este viaje por el oeste de los Estados Unidos, la mayor parte de México, Guatemala y Belice.

NUESTRO TRABAJO:

Utilizamos el autobús como un modelo para promover sistemas sostenibles, demostrando soluciones concretas a los muchos problemas que todos enfrentamos en la actualidad. El autobús funciona 98 por ciento del tiempo en el aceite vegetal usado, casi eliminando nuestra dependencia de los combustibles fósiles y reutilizando "residuos" que pueden contaminar las fuentes de agua. Toda nuestra electricidad es solar, eliminando nuestra dependencia hidroeléctrica o la energía nuclear. Cuando sea posible, recogemos y filtramos el agua de lluvia para beber y lavar. Nos lavamos la ropa con nuestra bici-lavadora, haciendo ejercicio en lugar de desperdiciar electricidad. Convertimos el 90 por ciento de nuestra "basura" en composta y materiales de construcción (Eco-ladrillos). Donde quiera que vamos, se promueve este tipo de "Eco-técnicas" a través de explicaciones, manuales físicos o virtuales, y talleres.

TALLERES:

  -Conversión de Motor a Aceite Vegetal @ Klimaforum, COP16 Puerto Morelos, Quintana Roo, México y el Foro Social Mundial, Ciudad de México, México

  - Reciclaje y Compostaje en escuelas/universidades en Rio Dulce, Guatemala media y en la feria de la ciudad en Maria Lombardo, Oaxaca, México

  - Música en la Escuela Primaria Pinguinos, San Cristóbal de las Casas, Chiapas, México

FOROS Y FESTIVALES:

  - Infraestructura, sonido en vivo, y concierto @ Viva la Milpa, la ciudad de Oaxaca, Oaxaca, México

  - Construcción de la infraestructura (cocina comunitaria, fontanería, duchas y estaciones de   lavado de manos) @ Klimaforum, COP16, Puerto Morelos, Quintana Roo, México

  - Sonido en vivo, transporte y logística @ Coctel de Femme, San Cristóbal de las Casas,   Chiapas, México

Hemos trabajado con las organizaciones y comunidades en proyectos de permacultura, bio-construcción y proyectos de tecnológias apropiadas, tales como bici-maquinas (Jaguar de Madera), instalaciones de energía solar (La Ventana), súper adobe, y construcciones de Eco-ladrillo y Earthship.

MÚSICA:

  - Hemos grabado tres discos originales en este viaje (El Primer Paso, Le Grand Voyage & YouRevolución), con estilos musicales que van desde el folk hasta el reggae y del Balcan eléctrica hasta cumbia.

  - Hemos hecho conciertos para recaudar fondos para centros artisticas/culturales y para   gente en necesidad. (El paliacate, EDELO, Aldea Organica)

  - Hemos grabado demos y álbumes en vivo para otros artistas (Kaguairán, Las Hermanas   Sista, y Nativo y Warriocandela)

  - Hemos tocado en conciertos en festivales, en plazas, en la calle y en escuelas.

MINI-DOCUMENTARIES/VIDEOS:

  - Permacultores, Mini-documental sobre El Jaguar de Madera, un centro de permacultura/bio-construcción en San Cristóbal de las   Casas, Chiapas, México

  - La Bici-Lavadora video del construcción de una lavadora de ropa que se alimenta a la base de la fuerza del pedaléo(Construido en Jaguar de Madera)

  - Sangre, Sudor y Polvora, video promocional y poético sobre El Paliacate, un centro cultural en San Cristóbal de las Casas, Chiapas, México

  - Primeros Pasos, seis mini-documentales sobre Primeros Pasos, una clínica sin fines de lucro que brinda servicios médicos gratuitos a las comunidades circundantes Quetzaltenango, Guatemala

  - Panaderia Los Sueños, una panadería que se dedica a ayudar a los adolescentes en situación de riesgo en San Cristóbal de las Casas, Chiapas, México

HOY:

Ahora estamos en Quetzaltenango, Guatemala donde acabamos de finalizar seis videos (mini-documentales/promocionales) para la clinica "Primeros Pasos". Ahora estamos juntando un banco de diversas semillas, criollas y organicas, para iniciar el Banco de Semillas SoulFire, organizando un festival de música para exhibir a talentosas bandas locales y pronto empezaremos dos proyectos de bici-máquinas. Despues de eso, el plan es continuar hacia el sur, a través de América Central y hasta Brasil - a seguir creciendo esta red y compartiendo y promoviendo estas herramientas para el cambio con todas las personas que están dispuestos y abiertos al conocimiento que tenemos de compartir.

LO QUE NECESITAMOS:

En este momento nuestro autobús en una condición que hace imposible continuar hacia el sur. Para mantener este proyecto en movimiento, necesitamos recaudar $9,000 para realizar el trabajo de mantenimiento en nuestro querido bus:

- Servicio de transmisión, cambio de empaques y 11 cuartos de galón cambio de aceite del engranaje = $1,200

- Servicio de la bomba de aceite y reemplazo del empaque de la bomba y el carter + 6   galones cambio de aceite del motor. ($100 en empaques, $160 en el aceite del motor + 6.5 horas de trabajo) = $910

- Cartucho (repuesto) del sistema de aire y servicio de secador de aire = $550

- Servicio de compresora de aire ($500) O reemplazo ($960)

- Volante y eje de transmisión engrase (60 dólares grasa + 1,5 horas de trabajo) = $110

- Los filtros de aceite y combustible reemplazados (filtros + 1,5 horas de trabajo) = $200

- Servicio diferencial y cambio de aceite (14 cuartos 50w Gear Lube + 1 hora de trabajo) = $480

- Eje/rueda útil de los rodamientos y cambio de aceite (rodamientos de la rueda, juntas y 2 cuartos 50w Gear Lube + 3 horas de trabajo por cada lado) = $800

- Llanta de repuesto (montado en la rueda) = $700

- Nuevo (DPF) Filtro de Particulas para motor Diesel = $780

- "Running the Rack" (afincion típico del motor Detroit Diesel) 6-10 horas de trabajo = $1,000-1,600 (depende si el motor necesita nuevas armas balancines de inyector y los   inyectores.)

Si superamos nuestro objetivo para este trabajo de mantenimiento O queda algo extra, sepa que se vaya poner a buen uso. Nuestra "Caja de Herramientas" es una lista de deseos - cosas que nos pueden ayudar mucho.

Proyecto SoulFire "Caja de Herramientas"

  - (4) Jack stand de alta resistencia para ayudar a guardar la vida de nuestros muelles.

  - (2) Paneles solares de 100w 12v para poder utilizar nuestro sistema solar para hacer   proyecciones, conciertos y obras con las herramientas eléctricas.

  - (1) Proyector para poder realizar noches de cine al aire libre, proyectando documentales y nuestras propias películas directamente desde el bus!

LO QUE USTED CONSIGUE CON SU CONTRIBUCIÓN:

Tenemos muchos únicos regalos, desde álbumes originales del Proyecto SoulFire...


hasta playeras SoulFire, serigrafiado a mano...


hasta estancia de una semana, todo incluido, en el Bus SoulFire!

$10 - Dos álbumes virtuales de su elección (El Primer Paso, Le Grand Voyage, YouRevolución)

$25 - Los tres álbumes virtuales + todos los álbumes virtuales realizadas entre el aquí y el Brasil!

$50 - La elección de un álbum físico, todos los álbumes virtuales realizados y actualizaciones del proyecto entre aquí y Brasil + 2 pegatinas del autobus SOULFIRE.

$100 - La elección de dos álbumes físicos, un Proyecto SoulFire camiseta (serigrafia a mano) y una pegatina del SoulFire bus.

$250 - SoulFire Medios Paquete: Todos los tres álbumes físicos, HD DVD de TODAS nuestras mini-documentales y vídeos promocionales, SoulFire proyecto t-shirt, cartel de concierto y pegatina del bus.

$500 – Todo en la lista anterior + todo incluido estancia de una semana en el autobus SoulFire! (transporte no incluido)

$700 - Todo incluido estancia de una semana en el autobús con la familia SoulFire Y, instrucciones paso a paso personalizado (via Skype) de como convertir su motor diesel para funcionar con aceite vegetal usado!

$1000 - Todo en la lista anterior, además de una estancia de una semana en el autobús para ti Y un acompañante + tu nombre dentro del autobús en nuestro “ESQUINA DE HEROES"

Incluso si usted no puede contribuir económicamente, simplemente correr la voz a todos los que conoces es tan valioso! Por favor, comparta nuestro perfil Indiegogo en Facebook, Twitter, o por correo electrónico! Gracias de antemano por su ayuda. Usted realmente no tiene idea de lo mucho que esto será apreciada.

¡GRACIAS!

Si quiere saber mas del Proyecto SoulFire nos puede visitar en nuestra pagina de web: www.soulfireproject.wix.com/soulfireproject

O en Facebook: www.facebook.com/soulfireproject
story_txt:
*español abajo 
The SoulFire Project
An Artistically Self-Sustainable Mobile
Community
MISSION:
The SoulFire Project has two objectives: First, to live in a
sustainable way within our mobile community, as well as with nature, the people and the communities we meet along the journey; Second, to use art and
eco-techniques to promote and grow this movement towards a more sustainable
future.
SHORT HISTORY:
In late 2008, my best friend Przemek and I (Cooper) started
to convert our 1979 Crown Supercoach school bus into a mobile
home/workshop/studio. Using many recycled and reclaimed building materials, and
with the help and support of family and many friends, we converted the
interior. We built and installed eight bunk beds, a kitchen, a wood stove, a
"living room", and shelving. Through a lot of research and a
huge learning curve of trial and error, we successfully converted the engine to
run on waste vegetable oil. After a year of hard work, mistakes, and learning,
we gathered our tools, our musical instruments, our faith, five good friends,
and hit the road south. 
Since leaving Oregon in November 2009, The SoulFire Project has travelled over 20,000 miles on waste vegetable oil. More than 100 artists, musicians, builders, engineers, and filmmakers from all over the world have shared various parts of this journey through the western United States, the majority of Mexico, Guatemala, and Belize.
OUR WORK:
We use the
bus as a model to promote sustainable systems, demonstrating concrete solutions
to many problems that we all face today. The bus runs 98 percent of the time on
waste vegetable oil, almost eliminating our dependency on fossil fuels and reusing
“waste” that can contaminate water sources while drastically reducing our carbon footprint. All of our electricity is solar-powered, eliminating our dependence on coal, hydro-electric or nuclear power. When possible,
we catch and filter rainwater for drinking and washing. We wash our clothes
with our bicycle-powered washing machine, getting exercise while saving electricity. We convert 90 percent of our “garbage” into compost and building
materials (Eco-Bricks), which we save and give to projects that have land on
which to build with them. Everywhere we go, we promote these kinds of
“Eco-Techniques” through physical or virtual manuals and
workshops.
WORKSHOPS:
-Vegetable Oil Conversion @ Klimaforum,
COP16 Puerto Morelos, Quintana Roo,
Mexico and the World Social Forum, Mexico
City, Mexico.
- Recycling and Composting
in middle schools/universities in Rio
Dulce, Guatemala and at the town fair in Maria Lombardo, Oaxaca, Mexico.
- Music at Pinguinos
Elementary School, San Cristobal de las
Casas, Chiapas, Mexico


FORUMS & FESTIVALS:
-  Infrastructure, live sound, and concert @
Viva la Milpa, Oaxaca City, Oaxaca, Mexico
-  Construction of infrastructure (community
kitchen, plumbing, showers, and hand-washing stations) @ Klimaforum, COP16 Puerto Morelos, Quintana Roo, Mexico
- 
Live sound, transportation and logistics @ Coctel de Femme, San Cristobal de las Casas,
Chiapas, Mexico




We have worked with organizations and communities on
permaculture, bio-building and appropriated technology projects such as bicycle
machines (Jaguar de Madera), solar power installations (La Ventana), super
adobe, Eco-Brick and Earthship constructions.
MUSIC:
- 
We’ve recorded three original albums on this
journey (El Primer Paso, Le Grand Voyage & YouRevolución), with musical styles ranging from
folk to reggae and from electric Balkan to cumbia.
- 
We have done fundraising & awareness concerts
for art/cultural centers and for people in need.  (El Paliacate, EDELO, Aldea Organica)
- 
We have recorded demos and live albums for other
artists (Kaguairán,
Las Hermanas Sista, and Dr. Nativo y Los Warriorcandela)
- 
We have played concerts at festivals, in plazas,
in the streets, and in schools. 
MINI-DOCUMENTARIES/VIDEOS:
-  Primeros Pasos, Six promotional/mini-documentary videos about Primeros Pasos, a non-profit clinic that offers free medical services to communities surrounding Quetzaltenango, Guatemala
- The Bicycle Washing Machine, Video exploring the construction of a bicycle-powered washing machine (built at Jaguar de Madera)
- 
Permacultores, Mini-documentary about,"El Jaguar de Madera" a permaculture/bio-building center in San Cristobal de las Casas,
Chiapas, Mexico
- 
Blood, Sweat and Gun Powder, A poetic promotional video for,"El Paliacate" a cultural center in San Cristobal de las Casas, Chiapas, Mexico
- 
Panaderia Los Sueños, Two promotional videos for, "The Dream Bakery" a bakery dedicated to helping at-risk teens in San Cristobal de
las Casas, Chiapas, Mexico
TODAY:
Right now
we are in Quetzaltenango, Guatemala where we have just finished making six
mini-documentary/promotional videos for the “Primeros Pasos” clinic. We are now gathering a diverse bank of local organic seeds to start the
SoulFire Seed Bank, organizing a music festival to showcase local bands and will soon be starting two different bicycle-machine projects. After this, the plan is to continue south, through Central
America and to Brazil - to continue growing this network and sharing and
promoting these tools for change with all the people who are ready and open to
the knowledge we have to share. 
WHAT WE NEED:
Right now our bus in a condition
that makes it impossible to continue south. To keep this project moving, we
need to raise $9,000 to complete the maintenance overhaul on our beloved bus:
- 
Full transmission service, seal replacement and
11-quart gear oil change = $1,400
- 
Oil pump service & seal replacement on pump
and pan + 6 gallon motor oil change. ($100 in seals, $160 in motor oil + 6.5
hrs labor) = $910
- 
Air system & air dryer service + replacement
cartridge = $550
- 
Air compressor service ($500) OR replacement
($960)
- 
Steering & driveshaft linkage greasing ($60
grease + 1.5 hrs labor) = $110
- 
Oil and fuel filters replaced (filters + 1.5 hrs
labor) = $200
- 
Differential service & oil change (14 quarts
50w gear lube + 3 hr labor) = $680
- 
Hub/wheel bearing service & oil change (replacement
wheel bearings, seals & 2 quarts 50w gear lube + 3 hrs labor per side) =
$1,200
- 
Spare tire (mounted on rim) = $700
- New DPF (Diesel Particulate Filter) = $780
- 
“Running the Rack” (typical Detroit Diesel
engine tune-up) 6-10 hrs labor = $1,000-1,600 (depending on whether motor needs
new injector rocker arms & injectors.)
If we surpass our goal for this maintenance overhaul OR have
anything left over, know that it will be put to good use. Our “Toolbox” is a
wish list of things that could help us out a lot.
SoulFire Project
“Toolbox”
- 
(4) Heavy duty jack stands to help save the life
of our leaf springs.
- 
(2) 100w 12v solar panels to be able to use our
solar system to do projections, concerts and construction with power tools.
- 
(1) Projector to be able to host open air theater
nights, projecting our own and others’ short films, documentaries, and movies
directly from the bus!


WHAT YOU’LL GET WITH
YOUR CONTRIBUTION:

We have many great and unique gifts, from original SoulFire Project albums...


to hand-screened SoulFire t-shirts...


to an all-inclusive one week stay on the SoulFire Bus!



Even if you can't contribute financially, just spreading the word to everyone you know is just as valuable! Please share our Indiegogo profile on Facebook, Twitter, or by good old fashioned email!

Thank you in advance for your help. You truly have no idea how much this will be appreciated.

THANK YOU!!!
To know more about the SoulFire Project, you can check us out at our website: www.soulfireproject.wix.com/soulfireproject
OR Facebook: www.facebook.com/soulfireproject

stand de alta resistencia para ayudar a guardar la vida de nuestros muelles.
  - (2) Paneles
solares de 100w 12v para poder utilizar nuestro sistema solar para hacer   proyecciones, conciertos y obras con las
herramientas eléctricas.
  - (1)
Proyector para poder realizar noches de cine al aire libre, proyectando documentales y nuestras
propias  películas directamente desde el
bus!

LO QUE USTED CONSIGUE CON SU CONTRIBUCIÓN:
Tenemos muchos únicos regalos, desde álbumes originales del Proyecto SoulFire...

hasta playeras SoulFire, serigrafiado a mano...

hasta estancia de una semana, todo incluido, en el Bus SoulFire!

$10 - Dos álbumes virtuales de su elección (El Primer Paso,
Le Grand Voyage, YouRevolución)
$25 - Los tres álbumes virtuales + todos los álbumes
virtuales realizadas entre el aquí y el Brasil!
$50 - La elección de un álbum físico, todos los álbumes
virtuales realizados y actualizaciones del proyecto entre aquí y Brasil + 2
pegatinas del autobus SOULFIRE.
$100 - La elección de dos álbumes físicos, un Proyecto
SoulFire camiseta (serigrafia a mano) y una pegatina del SoulFire bus.
$250 - SoulFire Medios Paquete: Todos los tres álbumes
físicos, HD DVD de TODAS nuestras mini-documentales y vídeos promocionales, SoulFire
proyecto t-shirt, cartel de concierto y pegatina del bus.
$500 – Todo en la lista anterior + todo incluido estancia
de una semana en el autobus SoulFire! (transporte no incluido)
$700 - Todo incluido estancia de una semana en el autobús
con la familia SoulFire Y, instrucciones paso a paso personalizado (via Skype) de
como convertir su motor diesel para funcionar con aceite vegetal usado!
$1000 - Todo en la lista anterior, además de una estancia
de una semana en el autobús para ti Y un acompañante + tu nombre dentro del
autobús en nuestro “ESQUINA DE HEROES"

Incluso si usted no puede contribuir económicamente, simplemente correr la voz a todos los que conoces es tan valioso! Por favor, comparta nuestro perfil Indiegogo en Facebook, Twitter, o por correo electrónico! Gracias de antemano por su ayuda. Usted realmente no tiene idea de lo mucho que esto será apreciada.
¡GRACIAS!
Si quiere saber mas del Proyecto SoulFire nos puede visitar en nuestra pagina de web: www.soulfireproject.wix.com/soulfireproject
O en Facebook: www.facebook.com/soulfireproject

story:
STRØM CITY IS HERE!

Introducing the best performing battery hidden in the frame, made detachable for charging. The most powerful and silent motor. The lightest aluminum frame (medium or large fit all heights) in 3 characteristic colors. A fully integrated lighting system that starts with a push of a button.

Check it out here

 

Designboom.com - "STRØM smartens up the fat bike with some Scandanavian panache" -

Stern.de - "Das E-Bike für jedes Gelände"

Trendhunter.com - "Designed to conquer city streets and sandy beaches"

Geeky-gadgets.com - "Designed to make your daily journey easier"

Danish magazine for men (mandesager) - "It is a cool e-bike with a very reasonable price tag"

Digitaltrends.com - "Not many ebikes can handle an adventure. STRØM is specifically designed for that."

Elektrobike-online.com - "Günstiges E-MTB aus Dänemark"

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Backers review

Lars Möser:  

"I was out today test-driving this lovely thing. I cannot wait till August. Wow it is cool" 

Andrias:

"I got a test ride on this iron horse yesterday and I know it's going to be a hit. Can't wait till August"

 

Enjoy the ride

Enjoy riding up to 50 miles (80 km) on a single charge with speeds of up to 20 mph (32 km/h). Easy adjust the amount of assist on the go and feel the joy of riding an electric bike. Ride full throttle or use the 4 level pedal-assist. 

 

 

Smart LCD Display

The LCD display makes your everyday riding a true pleasure. Take advantage of STRØM technology, as we have upgraded the bike with LCD display and easy to use thumb controller. Riding a bike has never been a more smooth experience.

 

 

Easy to use thumb controller

The thumb controller makes your daily ride a smooth experience. Easy adjust the assist level on the go by pressing the + or - buttons on the controller. This gives you full flexibility and the opportunity to design the ride to fit your mood.
 

 

The perfect all-round electric bike

The bike comes with a one-size frame equipped with 3" inch all-terrain tires. This combined with its silent powerful motor, long lasting battery, LCD display and ultra-soft saddle is designed to make any ride a true pleasure.

 

Timeless colours

We have selected what we think is the most timeless and trending colours. Metallic white, moon gray or matte black. The choice is yours!


 

EU MODEL VS. US MODEL

VAT for EU customers is set to 25% extra. For other countries please check your VAT as they vary from country to country.  Calculate taxes worldwide.

Please note that the US model is not legal within most European countries.

 

FACTS AND COMPONENTS

Talking about a spoiled bike is no understatement. We love tech and cool features. Therefore, we have not compromised on the equipment of the bike. Take a closer look below.

 

Portable battery for charging

 

 

Charge on the go

At STRØM Bike we are following society trends and have not overlooked the importance of staying connected. To knock off another excuse not to get on a bike, we created a built-in USB charger to keep you fully charged on the go.

 

Leave traffic behind

STRØM Bike is your daily motivation to get on a bike. With STRØM, traffic is no longer an issue. No more driving at a snail's pace and arriving late as a result of traffic jams. Instead, beat the daily traffic and experience the freedom of riding an electric bike.

 

 

Focus more on the moment, less on the destination

STRØM Bike allows you to focus more on the moment and less on the destination. The bikes ability to adapt to any riding situation is a true pleasure. Forget about frustrating tailwind and up-hill terrain. Instead adjust the amount of assist to fit your mood and let STRØM take you on new adventures.
 
 

 

Safety first

We designed STRØM Bike with safety in mind. The bike features a built-in LED light to keep you safer on the roads. It improves your visibility at night and makes it possible for cars to spot you from a long distance. The front LED light is connected to the battery box meaning no physical batteries are required on the front. Use the Easy to use thumb controller to turn it on and off. 

    About the founders and our goal

    We are two entrepreneurs (23, 26 y/o) who have known each other for nearly a decade. We met at a business high school in Denmark, and kept the friendship going. We have traveled together, worked together and shared hundreds of ideas together. We have now dropped our education and full time job to follow our heart and build STRØM Bike. 

    Our mission with STRØM Bike is to make inner city commuting more sustainable and convenient. We are convinced that we have build the perfect solution to do so. We believe in green transportation and know it's key for a greener and better future.

    To start up production we need $40.000. As a exclusive offer only on Indiegogo we are offering a 57 % discount to make sure we reach our goal. This is your chance to make a real steal on the most stylish and cool electric bike. At the same time, you support a Danish start-up with a vision for a greener future.

     



    Please note that canceled order will have a restocking fee of 8%

    Please note that the actual distance varies from your battery size pick and different factors like     temperature, weight, driving habits and more.

    Tax calculator

    Indiegogo refund policy

    www.stroembike.com

story:
Introducing RageBridge 2



RageBridge 2 is a no-frills and robust dual-channel DC motor controller for robotic and vehicular drivetrain applications. It can supply 50 amps per side continuously. An ultra-wide (8 to 40 volts) input range maximizes versatility and allows it to be used in many different systems. A large and fully isolated heat sink base allows you to attach it to a metal chassis for even better thermal performance. It weighs 4 ounces and is 4.15" x 2" x 0.9" without wires.


Architecture


RageBridge 2 is a dual H-bridge allowing control of up to two DC brush motors independently, integrated onto a single board. The switching topology of RageBridge 2 is known as "synchronous rectification." In this method, the motor is always being alternately powered and then braked.

While it may sound unnecessarily complicated, it significantly decreases heat dissipation in both motor and power MOSFETs because current is never just being burnt off as heat for a portion of the switching cycle.

The bidirectional current flow means the battery supply gets recharged when the motor is undergoing braking, with energy supplied from the kinetic energy of the moving drivetrain or actuator. This translates to an increase in run time of a few percent in most cases.



Constant Current Limiting


RageBridge differs again from most DC motor controllers in how it handles motors that are bigger than it should be driving!

1. The vast majority of controllers simply do not have any protection. That means a sudden short, drivetrain lockup, or motor failure will destroy the controller as it tries to flow the motor stall current. Sizing a controller to handle motor stall current is very impractical and expensive, often resulting in controllers being many times bigger than they need to be.

2. Many popular DC motor controllers today advertise "overcurrent protection." But often, they mean is the controller will shut down upon a certain current threshold, and often requires a power cycle or the load to drop to zero before enabling again. This means that under heavy acceleration, your robot or vehicle might just turn off all of a sudden, leaving it (or you) stranded. Once again, the controller has to be many times overrated in order to handle the load.



RageBridge 2 features an innovative hysteresis-based current limiting scheme where there is a true output current ceiling. The motor output current is sample 15,000 times every second, and if it is over the threshold, the output voltage is reduced each cycle until the current falls under the limit.

This results in a fluctuating output voltage whose average magnitude is just enough to maintain the maximum current. The sampling rate is fast enough to prevent a sudden motor stall from damaging the controller in most cases, and can even delay motor burnup significantly.


Risks & Challenges

 
We plan to be delivering the first batch of RageBridge 2's in late October 2015.    RageBridge 2 is the next generation of a proven product and is therefore much less risky to timely produce and deliver than an entirely new product. 


About Us


Equals Zero Designs is a collaboration founded in 2012 by MIT Mechanical Engineering graduate Charles Z. Guan of etotheipiplusone.net and Electric Vehicle & robot builder Adam Bercu to introduce products that are good ideas. We primarily target the hobbyist and educational market, focusing on robotics, electric mobility systems, and mechatronics.

All of our products are designed in-house and aim to fill gaps in the market for which no confident solutions exist. Our mission is to supply innovative products for hobbyists, students, and amateurs in mechanical and mechatronic design to succeed in building the creations of their dreams.


Thanks for your interest in RageBridge 2!


Even if you’re not able to donate funds to our campaign today, you can still help us out by sharing our campaign with friends and family. Check out the Indiegogo share tools below!

FAQ

  • "RageBridge2 looks like a great product. Is there a way to set it up as a single motor controller with higher current handling (i.e. 50+50=100amps)?"

YES! This feature is called Giga-mode and is standard on RageBridge 2!
It's selectable via a single jumper.

  • "I would like to know if it can also handle brushless DC motors."

    Sorry, RageBridge 2 is a two-channel DC motor controller, for brushed DC motors only!
  • Will there be room to solder screw terminals onto the board? Having to solder the wires directly makes it a pain to move between bots or have flexibility in placement.

We understand the tradeoffs between convenience and robustness & compactness. This version of Ragebridge will have solder eyelets only. We suggest using removable connectors in this application.

  • Is there CAD file or drawing available? I want to see if this fits in my design.

Why of course! CAD files are provided in Parasolid (.x_t) and IGES formats.

(to be filled up as questions roll in)

story:
Swyft - Keeping Campus Safe and Making Transportation Better

Campus safety has become an increasingly prevalent issue at Universities across the nation. Sexual assaults on American college campuses have now gotten the attention of the White House, and President Obama has addressed this matter. Potential campus victims need a better, more efficient way to get home and minimize the risk of being harassed or victimized.

Swyft is an application for campuses everywhere that have established student-staff transportation. It enables universities to better analyze ridership trends and data, provides quick ride booking access to students and staff, and allows campus police to track frequented pickup areas so that they can re-route their routines to be more accessible to students working late at night! Swyft endeavors to keep campuses safe and further empower the university community!

Remember: The only victory of a victim is survival. Let's help prevent criminal instances and protect our college campuses! 

What We Need 

Here's what the Swyft Team needs in order to pull through!

  • Backers that believe in our application!
  • University officials willing to Beta test 
  • Sharing our video with the world! Our ultimate goal is to serve Universities internationally!
  • Collaboration with organizations that are working to promote safety on college campuses.
  • If you are at all involved with a school that needs this service contact us so we can put our focus there!

The Impact

Swyft's main goal is to keep students safe by making their school transportation schedule more transparent. Here's what we're fighting for!

  • Lower Universities sexual harassment statistics by getting people home more quickly 
  • Enabling users to book through the app to avoid waiting outside at night
  • Helping university transportation departments track their rider-data
  • Enabling campus police to become more proactive against campus crime

Risks & Challenges

The current Challenges our team is facing involves the following:

  • Application Development Costs 
  • Marketing Costs (We need to get the word out!)

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help! If you take the conversation online, you can help us keep students safe!

  • Tweet our hashtag #SwyftCampus and #SaferCampus on Twitter and Facebook
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Contact us:

LieunxApps@gmail.com

@Swyft_ on Twitter

story:
Let's Make The Future Electric

Future Electric is a race team that builds high performance electric motorcycles for the race track.

Our vision is to push EV technology to the point where it becomes superior to internal combustion engine technology – in all levels of motorcycle racing.

It is Future Electric’s main short term goal to enter the FIM eRoad Racing World Cup in 2014.

In not so many words... We wish to build the World's Fastest Electric Motorcycle.


THE RACE BIKE


Max theoretical speed [High Gear]: 350 Km/h

Max theoretical speed [Low Gear]: 280 Km/h

Power Output: 150+ Kw / 200+ hp

0-100 Km/h: 2,5 seconds

Weight: 180 Kg


Do You Want To Be A Part Of Racing?

Here is your chance to literally become a part of the next generation of motorsports! 

Supporters of this campaign can get their beautiful face printed on the side of the race bike(s), and travel with us as we tour the globe and race in the US, Europe & Asia. 

This is the ultimate statement if you want to make the Future Electric! 


Why We Need Your Money


Let's start with the truth... 

Electric Race Bikes Don't Run On Gas, They Run On Cash!


The FIM eRoad Racing World Cup is, like MotoGP pushing the technical limits of the motorcycling sport. Technical innovation is the focus of the FIM eRoad Racing World Cup, and the bikes are literally rolling R&D platforms. This means that cost are relatively high. 

The $60,000 USD we wish to raise from this campaign will pay for a high performance liquid cooled AC motor, and a state of the art Hub Centre Steering for one of the race bikes. 

  


Why We Will Succeed Where Others Fail

Future Electric is a recognized EV enterprise, and is part of the Danish business cluster Insero E-Mobility. [More info HERE]


We have been working on entering the FIM eRoadRacing World Cup since 2011, and are in regular contact with the race series.

  

The Future Electric team is strong and consists of EV specialists and people with a background in aviation design, carbon fiber technology, and civil space industry. 

And to finish off on the funny side, our EV specialist Klaus Nissen holds the Guinness World Record for the worlds fastest electric mobility scooter.

  


Other Ways You Can Help

If you like this project, but don't have the money, then please help us by:

  • Sharing our campaign with other race enthusiasts

  • Follow us on Facebook 

 



...:: WARNING - NERDY TECH STUFF ::...

Right now the technical innovation of electric motorcycles is evolving much faster than fossil fuelled motorcycle development. Internal combustion technology has reached a point where it is being challenged by the new EV technology that looks to gain a huge advantage in the years to come.

Today’s most advanced electric motors are already better than current Moto GP motorcycle’s engines in terms of torque delivery, physical size, engine-braking control, and reduced gyroscopic handling impact. The small size of electrical components in electric motorcycles also gives room for better overall motorcycle design, which translates directly into better motorcycle handling and feel.

The top speeds in the FIM eRoad Racing World Cup practically doubled from 100 km/h to well over 200 km/h over the last four years, idea prime example of the huge technical leaps this race series is taking.
story_txt:
Let's Make The Future ElectricFuture Electric is a race team that builds high performance electric motorcycles for the race track.Our vision is to push EV technology to the point where it becomes superior to internal combustion engine technology – in all levels of motorcycle racing.It is Future Electric’s main short term goal to enter the FIM eRoad Racing World Cup in 2014.In not so many words... We wish to build the World's Fastest Electric Motorcycle.THE RACE BIKEMax theoretical speed [High Gear]: 350 Km/hMax theoretical speed [Low Gear]: 280 Km/hPower Output: 150+ Kw / 200+ hp0-100 Km/h: 2,5 secondsWeight: 180 KgDo You Want To Be A Part Of Racing?Here is your chance to literally become a part of the next generation of motorsports! Supporters of this campaign can get their beautiful face printed on the side of the race bike(s), and travel with us as we tour the globe and race in the US, Europe & Asia. This is the ultimate statement if you want to make the Future Electric! Why We Need Your MoneyLet's start with the truth... Electric Race Bikes Don't Run On Gas, They Run On Cash!The FIM eRoad Racing World Cup is, like MotoGP pushing the technical limits of the motorcycling sport. Technical innovation is the focus of the FIM eRoad Racing World Cup, and the bikes are literally rolling R&D platforms. This means that cost are relatively high. The $60,000 USD we wish to raise from this campaign will pay for a high performance liquid cooled AC motor, and a state of the art Hub Centre Steering for one of the race bikes.   Why We Will Succeed Where Others FailFuture Electric is a recognized EV enterprise, and is part of the Danish business cluster Insero E-Mobility. [More info HERE]We have been working on entering the FIM eRoadRacing World Cup since 2011, and are in regular contact with the race series.  The Future Electric team is strong and consists of EV specialists and people with a background in aviation design, carbon fiber technology, and civil space industry. And to finish off on the funny side, our EV specialist Klaus Nissen holds the Guinness World Record for the worlds fastest electric mobility scooter.  Other Ways You Can HelpIf you like this project, but don't have the money, then please help us by:
Sharing our campaign with other race enthusiasts

Follow us on Facebook 

 ...:: WARNING - NERDY TECH STUFF ::...Right now the technical innovation of electric motorcycles is evolving much faster than fossil fuelled motorcycle development. Internal combustion technology has reached a point where it is being challenged by the new EV technology that looks to gain a huge advantage in the years to come.Today’s most advanced electric motors are already better than current Moto GP motorcycle’s engines in terms of torque delivery, physical size, engine-braking control, and reduced gyroscopic handling impact. The small size of electrical components in electric motorcycles also gives room for better overall motorcycle design, which translates directly into better motorcycle handling and feel.The top speeds in the FIM eRoad Racing World Cup practically doubled from 100 km/h to well over 200 km/h over the last four years, idea prime example of the huge technical leaps this race series is taking.

story:
The wait is over. It's here.

The highly anticipated campaign is finally here and ready to kick-off! We're super excited and equally proud of the work everyone has put in to make this happen. We're now officially ready, set, GO! to bring this beauty out to all of you.

It's the new MATE X.

All hail the successor

Good things last. Great things get even better.

MATE X, the newest member of the MATE family, will definitely turn heads. It’s bigger, more powerful and certainly makes an impression. It’s got it all - the affordability, the image, the attitude. It’s also built to let you push your limits: Go ahead and venture off the beaten path. It’s your ride to ultimate freedom.

 

Meet the makers

Christian & Julie

Copenhagen siblings Christian Adel Michael and Julie Kronstrøm came up with MATE out of a shared passion for the bike. Their goal was to create an affordable, foldable, e-bike that is not only fun to ride but is cool enough to inspire everyone to hop onto one. With Christian’s natural-born entrepreneurial skills, combined with Julie’s business development and project management talents, their segue into realizing their dream has been an enormous success.

 

Ride in style. Ride with pride.

MATE X is much more than an upgrade. It’s a completely new bike. A bigger, and longer frame that is fitted with wide-rim fat tires. Its color scheme is fittingly more bold and extreme. 

Flying the MATE X colors

New colors are Subdued Black (Matte), White Ice, Burnt Orange, Desert Storm (Matte) plus a FOUNDERS EDITION special "Unicorn" coating.

For the MATE X, we've wiped the board and made an entirely new color scheme that fits the obvious, physical boldness of the bike's design. We want the coat to be an extension of what the MATE X expresses and embodies: More freedom, more attitude, less beaten paths.

 

Find your soul MATE

Simply pick your ride and get ready for the thrill of pure riding freedom!

 

Get in. Grind 'n go!

The new MATE X boasts a much more powerful motor of up to 750W combined with an impressive 48V battery and controller across all models. The two combined returns significantly increased torque – and a big WOW! when you feel it.

We’ve geared up by introducing Shimano 8-speed gearing with improved easy-gear shifting. The new computer display is equipped with a backlit LED as standard. We also offer the option to upgrade to a SMART beautiful display in color (pictured) for only 99 USD (149 USD value).

The foldable pedals are an entirely new design packaged in a more sturdy pedal frame for improved power-transfer.

We’ve also upgraded to Tektro braking system, including levers and calipers, for quicker, more efficient stopping power. We’re currently offering hydraulic braking systems for $129 USD upgrade for smoother braking that requires less braking force.  

 

Computer display

  • Easy-to-read display with backlit LCD
  • 6 speeds from 0 (no assist) to 5 (full assist)
  • On-the-go power-assist level adjustment
  • Displays all data needed incl. speed, distance, battery life
  • Configurable for personalized settings
  • Water-and dust-proof  
  • Built-in USB charger


SMART color display - upgrade option  

  • Full color LCD display for easier viewing
  • Monitored battery usage shown in %
  • Includes all functions of the original display
  • Access to advanced settings
  • Up to 9 speed settings
  • Upgrade is 99 USD extra (149 USD value)
 








 

Clean cockpit

  • Minimal design for a clean look
  • Grip shifting for quick, seamless gear changes
  • Ergonomic handlebar grips for long distance comfort
  • Brake levers at a fingertip’s reach
  • Computer display squarely in center of handlebar
     

 

Puncture-resistant, fat tires

  • 4.0” fat tires (20” wheels) with wider rims for ultimate comfort
  • Improved control and handling of the bike
  • Minimized risk of puncture with enhanced safety on the road
  • At check-out: Choose freely between Street/sand OR All-terrain tires

 


1-click foldable pedals

  • Quick and easy to operate
  • Fold nicely against crank arms to save space
  • Solid platform - all leg power transferred into ground speed

 


Full suspension

  • Front and rear suspension for smooth riding
  • Extra comfort for the lower back
  • Built to handle offroad adventures
  • Front suspension: Adjustable preload to match weight and riding style
  • Front suspension: Mechanical lock-out for riding on smooth roads

 



 

Disc brakes

  • Tektro mechanical disc brakes
  • Expert modulation for full control  
  • Strong braking power requiring a single finger to engage  

Hydraulic disc brakes - upgrade option  

  • Smoother, more reliable braking
  • Less pulling force on lever required – a fingertip will do!
  • Upgrade is 129 USD extra (199 USD value)

 



 

Expert shifting

  • Drivetrain optimized for smooth, reliable shifting
  • 8-speed drivetrain with SHIMANO gearing and derailleur
  • Ideal gear steps for seamless transitions between shifts
  • Single-handed gear operation to simplify your ride


Easy adjustment

  • Saddle, handlebar heights adjusted with simple lever flip
  • Easy handlebar rotation for ideal ergonomic position  

 


 

Plug and play wiring system

  • A unique MATE innovation
  • Allows for simple, easy servicing of your bike anywhere in the world
  • Makes maintaining/replacing/repairing all electrical parts a breeze
  • Easily connect lights and other accessories (to come in our webshop)
  • Developed thanks to funding from our first MATE campaign

 

Powerful 48V battery

  • Extremely powerful 48V lithium-ion battery
  • Strong climbing and acceleration capabilities
  • Built-in handle and fuse - easily removable from frame
  • 48V 14.5 Ah model (696Wh) offers assisted travel of up to 40-60 miles*
  • 48V 11 Ah model (528Wh) offers up to 30 miles with full electrical assistance*  

*Range estimates are contingent upon rider and towing weight, riding style, wind speed and terrain.

 




 

Frame

  • 100% forged 6061 aluminum alloy frame  
  • 6 pounds (2.7kg) (total bike weight ≈ 50 pounds (26 kg))

Available in 5 bold colors: Subdued Black (Matte), White Ice, Burnt Orange, Desert Storm (Matte) plus a FOUNDERS EDITION special "Unicorn" coating






MATE X Accessories

You can purchase these accessories to along with your MATE X. Click on the pictures to go to the checkout page. 

**If you ordered a "MATEing Season" or "XOXO" package and want both of your bikes to be upgraded, simply purchase the same perk twice**

  


  
   

 

  

  

It will fold. But not under pressure.

As always, the MATE X is foldable in 3 easy steps to reduce its volume. It folds down to a very compact 78 cm high, 103 cm long, 59 cm wide. (Unfolded: 124 cm high, 180 cm long, 65 cm wide)This means you can bring it along anywhere you want to turn everywhere you go into an adventure!

 

Riding the saddle of success

With the help of each one of you, the backers, the first MATE did really well. We're extremely proud of being the world's best funded foldable bike ever. But what really makes a difference for us is the fact the we've made many thousands more jump on a bike. Actually, it just goes to show what a lot of people all over the world can do if they pull together.

That's what keeps us going - through the hard times where we’ve really dealt with a lot. And by coming out the other end of it, we are stronger, more motivated and more prepared to take the Mate Bike brand to an entirely new level. We are excited to bring all that we’ve accumulated over the last couple of years back to you in the form of MATE X.

Together we made a statement with first campaign and showed the world that big things can be accomplished. Let's do it again. Let's get those big fat tires rollin' all around the world. MATE X, your newest best MATE!

 

Experience has improved production

A wise man once said that you need to fail hard before you can succeed. Although we haven't quite hit rock bottom, we definitely have been challenged hard during the last campaign. At times it's been tough, but we've learnt from our mistakes and used the experiences to avoid repetition. In particular, we’ve nailed two key areas the last year - manufacturing and logistics.  

We're now ready and confident that all touch-points from ordering to delivery will live up to expectations.

 

Our goal is set. Let’s reach it together.

We’re done with prototyping  and are currently optimising parts, configurations and logistics. To start up the production, we have set a goal of $50,000 for this campaign. We want to take this bike to the next level and get even more people out on the saddle.

With this said, everyone who helps us in the making of the next MATE eBike, will get it at less than 1/2 the retail price – and will be the first to be offered exclusive, premium perks as well as VIP access to the upcoming webstore.

 

We are MATE family

Since the last campaign, we’ve worked very hard on improving every aspect of our company. We’ve built an order- and customer service system from scratch. We are training our support team to handle the huge demands, as well as preparing them for future challenges. We have learnt our lessons (dearly!) and have employed help in most areas. Our Mate family now totals 10 full-time members, all pulling their weight and making things happen. We’ve invested in a MATE Lab, where we test the bikes, including components, to work on improvements. Adding an in-house mechanic has certainly helped as well as providing valuable feedback for MATE moving forward.

 

You're much more than a customer

We’re not only building a bike or a brand, but rather seeding a community of encouragement while we grow our company along with our backers. We’re constantly improving both the bikes and our own performances, listening to and seriously taking in feedback.

In essence, our bikes are made by each one of you! THIS is and always will be our fundamental mission to accomplish - making the best MATE’s for everyone.

 

What our customers are saying about us

MATE is the biggest crowdfunding success ever in bike-crazy Denmark, with people from all over the world continuing to support the project. There are currently close to 10,000 MATE Bikes in circulation, helping to make traffic cleaner, cooler and run more smoothly. Through the community of MATE backers, we have received loads of feedback that’s made it possible to create the next generation of eBikes.

In the last 3 months, 70% of our Trustpilot reviews were 4 and 5 stars. We expect our ratings to continue to improve! Now that our growing pains have all been worked out through our original MATE series production (which caused long delays in delivery), it's smooth sailing from here on out.

 

Others are talking about us too

 

Spread the love. Let's make MATE X happen!

 

The Cycling Embassy of Denmark was founded in 2009 to make it easy for poli­ticians, planners, engineers, architects, journalists, NGOs all over the world to access our know-how and help cities around the globe make cycling an important part of their urban transporta­tion.

The members of the Cycling Embassy of Denmark represent the latest knowledge of all areas related to cy­cling.

 

Frequently Asked Questions

The price is very low for an e-bike. How is that possible?

Our extensive experience in product sourcing and manufacturing helped us a lot to secure and develop excellent supplier and shipping partnerships so we can offer a high quality product for the lowest possible price. 
Crowdfunding certainly helps us to keep the costs down so we can work together with the factory to product the right amount of units, without dealing with high storage costs and other related expenses

Can I order MATE X 750 even though I do not live in US?

We deliver MATE X 750S anywhere in the world as long as local laws permit us to import Mate
NB: It is not officially legal to drive MATE X 750S on public roads in the EU. You are allowed to own it and drive it on private property.
NB: We have not obtained an import permit for MATE X 750S in Australia. We advise Australian backers to get a MATE X 250 or MATE X 250+

How much weight can MATE X handle?

MATE X is built strong enough to easily handle riders of up to 150 kg.

Does MATE X come in different sizes?

MATE X is designed to fit everyone from 150 cm /4’9” to those over 215 cm / 7’0” with ease. Just adjust the saddle and handlebar height to match your measurements and off you go.

I can't see the battery - where is it?

Batteries are not something that should be felt, not seen. That’s why ours is hidden nicely within the frame, protected by a locking mechanism.

Can I still ride my MATE X if the battery runs out of power?

Of course! If you run out of power, you can ride it as you would a regular bicycle.

Can the battery be removed?

Yes. The battery is designed in such a way that you can change it or replace with 2 easy steps that take less than a minute. Simply fold the bike frame at the middle, pull out the battery and you’re done.

How is MATE X delivered and is it easy to assemble?

MATE X is delivered with instructions in a securely packed box and requires minimal assembly. However, if you don't have much experience with bikes, we strongly recommend that you visit your local bike shop to get all parts tightened and thoroughly checked for the best experience.

How much does shipping cost?

Shipping is set to $200 due to the fact that we ship worldwide directly from our factory in Asia. It is also one of the reasons its possible to keep MATE X prices so competitive, as there are no intermediaries between you and the factory #MATEaffordable.
NB: Application of extra shipping costs:  if you are in a “difficult to ship area”, such as remote locations, extra shipping costs may be applied. Please also note that some destinations, such as remote islands, can prove simply impossible to ship to. If you think you live in a hard-to-reach location, then please contact us before placing your order.

My bike box arrived damaged. What should i do?

If there is visible damage to your MATE box that appears to have damaged the bike and/or its other contents, please notify the courier immediately as they are held responsible for all damage caused in transit. Request documentation from them stating that you have received a box with visible damages. You will need this for insurance purposes to qualify for a replacement MATE X. 

I live in Denmark, can I pick it up myself?

No. MATE X eBike is ordered in bulk and will be shipping to individuals directly from our assembly in Asia, as well as to regional commercial warehouses that is not setup for walk-in or local pickup.
All MATE X’s will be shipped via ground shipping to your address we have on file.

Why is my bike spec’d with a component that differs from that listed on your site?

MATE X is still in its prototype stage, so some components are subject to change if we find better, more suitable replacements. Once past this stage, we will continue to reserve the right to switch components for ones equal or higher in value. The purpose of this is to ensure that the customer continues to get the best value bike for the price.

What kind of warranty do you offer?

All MATE bikes and batteries come with a 2 year limited manufacturer's warranty. Should you encounter some production related manufacturer’s defect during this time, we will take care of it according to our warranty. As many elements of a bike may get damaged due to normal cycling use/natural ware, we do not offer warranty on parts such as tires, disc brakes, chain, brake pads, etc. For more details, please contact our customer service department.

What is your returns policy?

This is the "MATE-promise": We are so confident that you will love your new MATE so much, that we offer you a 14 days money back guarantee after you have received it, if you are not satisfied.
However, if you decide to do so, your MATE bike must be in new and re-sellable condition. #MATEpromise

Returns shipping to our nearest regional warehouse must be covered by you.

What kind of accessories do you currently have or can I expect in the near future?

We are soon offering a more powerful battery for MATE X 250+ and MATE X 750S only, as an upgrade or as spare battery. We are currently working to develop  a GPS, rear-rack with brake lights and more accessories and modifications, that we will introduce during the campaign.
Stay tuned for more information. Feel free to let us know what kind of accessories you’d be most interested in seeing. 

What about spare parts? Can any bike shop assist me?

The MATE X battery is custom built for our frame. These batteries you can buy directly from us. The rest of the components are fairly standard, so you can upgrade/repair/customize your bike as you wish with other parts either from us or your local bike shop.

Is it really true I can get up to 80 miles on a single charge with "BOOSTER"?

In ideal conditions and in ECO+ mode = Assist level 1, this can be done.
Keep in mind, though, that other factors can also influence your reach such as power assist setting, terrain, total bike/rider weight, weather and riding conditions (city vs countryside). City or country side riding On "BOOSTER" battery, you can get anywhere between 20-100 miles, depending on your riding style. For maximum range, it certainly helps to add a bit of human power - especially on steep climbs and when accelerating.
**All MILES/KILOMETERS listed on Indiegogo are "UP TO" and not guaranteed.**

Do I need a licence to ride MATE X?

No. Our bikes are made 100% street legal. We offer two distinctive versions of MATE: MATE X 250 / 250+, with a 250W motor which is legal in the EU, and MATE X 750S, with a 750W motor for the US.

MATE X 250 and 250+ with 250W motor, is by default limited according to EN15194 to the top speed of 25 km/h (15,5 mph). This means that the motor will only help you up to 25km/h. MATE X 750S, with its 750W motor, is limited to 20 mph (32 km/h), which is the legal limit in US. It will be possible to change these settings with some reprogramming which we will make available after the campaign through MATE.community.

Who is responsible for any additional taxes, duties or VAT/GST?

The backer is responsible for these costs. Please check your country's import duties/VAT/GST before purchasing. It is currently 0% in the US and varies internationally. 

Duties/VAT/GTS is to be paid before we can deliver your MATE X. We will send payment links, invoice overview and ask for a final delivery address confirmation before we ship your MATE X. 

Can I test ride a MATE X bike?

At this stage, test rides are only available in Copenhagen. Contact us by email for a test ride.

Can I get a refund?

Please refer to IndieGoGo's policy here.

In the event we are unable to deliver your MATE X to your location due to any legal restrictions on the import or delivery of your bike, we shall refund you 75% of the amount on your indiegogo campaign contribution. You are responsible for determining whether its legal to import, deliver, and operate the MATE X at your location. In the even you cancel your Indiegogo contribution more than 10 days after it was made, we will assess an administration fee of 25% of your pledge and shall refund the remainder. 

Can I change my order?

Yes, it is possible to upgrade or downgrade your product. If we are still in the campaign period, the best way is to ask for a refund is through your profile on Indiegogo where you’ll find a “refund” button. And then “back” a new perk/make the order again. If the order is locked and you are transferred to our database, we charge an additional fee on 50 USD in administration fees.


MATE X is Design Registered with the European Intellectual Property Office 

Additional questions? 
Contact us at hello@mate.bike 

PRESS & PR: Hotline +45 9197 2643 // Mail: PR@mate.bike
