The bike will be comfortable, the frame handmade, and customized to each body type. We opportunise on our active friends: afternoons passed discussing the use of a  cargo bike on a daily basis either as a bike messenger, or while carrying fruit crates to the farmer markets. Hours passed drawing sketches on paper and perfecting with CAD software. Long discussions with framebuilders, many hours spent in our bike kitchen chatting, choosing, trying. 

Now we have got a pretty well-defined project and we are very close to our target.We have the ideas, but we need everyone's help to bring them into reality! Your contribution can go even further than the pure founding. To realize the best cargo bike we developed a new way of designing divided in steps that need collective help. To start, we need at least 2500 Euros. This is the effective cost of  producing the first prototype and running the first test. The frame is going to be handmade for us by an Italian frame builder and we are going to use components (saddle, handlebar, wheels...) mostly made in Italy. An ethical and sustainable choice, that takes into consideration the economical and functional side without sacrificing world-famous Italian quality!  Once we have the first prototype, the collective tests step will begin. Anyone can become our tester! We will collect all opinions, compare them and only then we will be able to review the project. Just with the help of many of you, the first prototype will be improved since it will become the perfect cargo bike.   Even the name of the cargo bike model will be chosen collectively. We need your help to choose it.   But we want to go above and beyond this initial goal.
If we collect 4500 Euros, we will build a second prototype. This will be re-designed according to the first guideline that comes out from the 
first tests. 
If we collect 7000 Euros, we will build three prototypes. Above all, after the tests are done, we will generate a network of of producers that will enable us to produce and commercialize  our tested cargo bike in a short period of time  and sell it for an affordable price, keeping the frame production in Italy and the in-house production line.
Good Ideas can grow only in cooperative groups. Many people, many experiences, many sources, many passions, one love in common: bikes! We met each other in CiclOstile Trento Bike Kitchen fixing bikes,  chatting, having a drink together we start to talk about cargos; after months of chatting, sketches and homemade experiments, we decided that the project is now ready to become a real bike. 
Help us to make it real!

Please refer to the following contacts for more information about this project, payment methods, and future perspectives.

officinaciclostile@gmail.com 


https://www.facebook.com/ciclostile.officinapopolare


https://www.facebook.com/longtailcargobike  



Versione Italiana        -       English version

story:
Thanks to everyone who supported PolitePersistence. 
We have begun development and plan to roll out PolitePersistence soon. 
Get on the Beta List at www.PolitePersistence.com 
UPDATE as of July 2014: Where the &$*% is PolitePersistence?
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

27 Seconds On How PolitePersistence Will Make Your Life Better


60 Seconds on How PolitePersistence Works


---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
“If you’re going to send one email, you may as well send three or four.”

 – Donald Asher, Career Guru


My name is John.  I’m an ordinary guy who has ordinary likes and dislikes.  I like people who are polite.  I like people who are persistent.  I dislike having to spend time on meaningless work.  

You get the picture.  

My wife, friends and I created PolitePersistence in response to these likes and dislikes. 

We like connecting with others and do so frequently by email.  But, we dislike having to spend time tracking our email output to potential business partners or cool people we want to get to know.  We also have minor panic attacks when we forget to send a timely follow up email when we haven’t received a reply to our increasingly desperate attempts at human interaction.  We’re seeking help.

Until we evolve more as humans, PolitePersistence is how we save time.  Here's how it works:

0. Connect PolitePersistence with a Gmail email account. (See below in the FAQ for how you can use PolitePersistence with ANY email account) 

1. I click on the PolitePersistence icon to go into ULTRA TIME SAVING MODE. I then write my initial introduction email to my childhood hero, now turned self-help book author, and cooking show judge by clicking on the first tab.    Cue trumpets!

2. From the same compose screen as my introduction email, I write out my follow up emails that will zip out automatically at scheduled intervals should my initial email get lost in the deluge of fan mail, business mail, or pool of human distraction that drowns all introduction emails.  I’m not bitter.  

3. I set the date and time for each email and click initiate.  

4. That’s it.


If the person replies to my initial email ahead of my scheduled follow up, PolitePersistence stops being persistent, and politely cancels the email follow up.  How? We wrote politeness into the code.  

This is what the process looks like visually:


Step 1. Turn on PolitePersistence in Gmail.

Step 2. Compose all ofyour emails fro m introduction through to follow up.


Step 3. Schedule your follow up emails and click initiate.




Step 4. Move on, panic free. Yay! Yippee! Three cheers for regular heartbeats! Just me? 

------------------------

We'd like your help.


Paula and I (John) mustache you a question...but we'll shave it for later.

Me, my wife, my friends, my toy poodle, and many other members of our team would like to learn if PolitePersistence can help more people than just us.  

We want to invest in better technical expertise, a set of servers and push our small baby bird of a solution out of the nest.  We hope it will fly.  But, who knows, maybe it won’t fly.  It could turn out to be one of those huge, problem eating, dino-sized birds that only walk, devouring your wasted time, and giving you a huge boost in life productivity.  Evolution isn’t an exact science.  But, I digress.

If you think this is cool, and useful, back us by clicking on a tab to the right of this plea for acceptance.  I love you.

------------------------

I also love fun facts. In case you do too...

Americans spend a collective 329 million hours online checking and writing e-mail per month! [Nielsen Online]

Reducing this by 1% would allow us to...

...do cooler things for an additional 3,290,000 hours, 137,083 days, or 375 years every month!

On average, we spend 28% of our workweeks reading, writing or responding to email. This means we spend about 650 hours a year on email! [McKinsey Global Institute & International Data Corporation]

Reducing this by 1% would allow us to...

...work more meaningfully!

------------------------

What You Get

  • PolitePersistence Backer Badges Pack and Backer Newsletter! - The Backer Badges Pack contains stickers that say (1)“Official PolitePersistence Backer”, (2) “[Logo] PolitePersistence Save Time. #EmailOnce”, and (3) our Logo  

    Our Backer Newsletter will be for Backers only. Backers can expect to hear about PolitePersistence news before the general public and media. Also, Backer Newsletter subscribers will have ability to respond and provide input and/or votes on future product development and strategy of the PolitePersistence brand.

  • Exclusive PolitePersistence Beta Access - Back PolitePersistence and get 20-25% discount on your license. Only backers of this campaign will be able to invite new users to PolitePersistence once we are live for a limited time.
  • Prop Perk - Receive team signed Happy Email props used in our video. 

  • Life Time Access to the PolitePersistence Platform - Need we say more..

  • PolitePersistence Backer Hall of Fame - Whether you want to post an advertisement for your company or ask your loved one to marry you - whatever the message is (as long as its clean and tasteful) will be posted forever on our Hall of Fame page at PolitePersistence.com. 
  • Our Crowdfunding Experience Sessions (1 Available) - Connect with our PolitePersistence team in three one-on-one sessions via Skype or Google Hangout. Ask us anything and learn from our mistakes. Great if you are planning on launching a crowdfunding campaign of your own in the near future. Sessions include: idea generation, campaign content evaluation, perk review, marketing strategy, overall crowdfunding campaign management, etc. We will literally become an extension of your team. 
  • Paid Account Named After You (1 Available)- We are serious about making you a part of our team... we can’t think of a better way than allowing our most prized donor to have his or her name forever immortalized on our site. Our ‘PolitePro Paid Account’ will become ‘Polite[Your Last Name] Paid Account’ I personally think ‘PoliteGenovese’ has a nice ring to it. This perk also comes with an Honorary Board Member position. 
  • PolitePersistence Partner Perk - That's a lot of P's. We've partnered with a great company to offer you an one-on-one consulting hour with a top industry professional. 

Domenick Cilea, CEO

------------------------

Other Ways You Can Help

We shared this with anyone who we knew spent a lot of time using email and they thanked us for it.

Go 'head. Generate some goodwill with your friends, family and contacts by telling them about PolitePersistence. 

You can use our campaign buttons to share below.

------------------------

FAQs


1) How is PolitePersistence different from services like Aweber or Mail Chimp?

PolitePersistence is not email marketing.  It's a personal, one-on-one relationship building tool.  It saves time on a human scale.


2) How is PolitePersistence different from services like Boomerang or Followup.cc?

I use these tools.  But, I want more.  I’d like to make email introductions, follow-ups, and connection as easy as possible by cutting out the middleman known as 'follow up reminder'.  I think PolitePersistence does so.


3) How do I know if PolitePersistence is right for me?

PolitePersistence is the peanut to your butter.  If you have butter, then it’s right for you.  Other than that, you can only know, if you try.


4) Can I use PolitePersistence with another email client other than Gmail?

Glad you asked. As a matter of fact you can! We specifically wrote a blog post for people like you. Check it out here: http://www.politepersistence.com/blog-post/how-combine-all-your-email-addresses-one-inbox-politepersistence 


-----------------

Special thanks to Alex and team at Third Curtain Productions for our video as well as Jerone Hsu and Chris Chavez of Prime Produce for their idea sauce.

We have begun development and plan to roll out PolitePersistence soon. 
Get on the Beta List at www.PolitePersistence.com

story:
Hard getting up from the chair? Push will help you up from any sitting position! Sit anywhere, on this foldable portable device.

The physically impaired, the pregnant, people with back pain, wheelchair users, nursing homes, hospitals, patient transportation and more can use this chair device and the upgrades that will follow.

Everybody with difficulties getting up from a sitting position can be helped by this easily portable device. 

Click the handle, pull up and push down. You will use your own momentum to give yourself a push out of whatever you are sitting in.

Unfold

Click the handle, pull up​

Push down

Pull up and fold

Pick up and go

The funding is for prototyping and launching a commercial product.

Risks and challenges:

The biggest challenge in this project is getting sufficient funds to turn the 3D-model into a prototype, and the prototype into a finished product.

I am a 35-year old 3D-designer with a family of 5, 6 if you count the cat.

I was watching my pregnant girlfriend try to get up from the sofa when I got this idea 3 years ago. 

I live in Northern Norway and hope to become self-employed developing ideas for helping people. 

If I can get this project founded, it would mean the world to me and can ease living for millions of people world wide.

This is my first attempt here at Indiegogo, or on any crowd funding site for that matter. I am looking forward to trying this and hoping for feedback on the product or anything else.

I will use pro-builders and engineers to build the prototype of my 3D-design, and will find the best economic alternative to build the finished product to keep the price as low as possible.  

I want this to be a product everyone in need of it can afford.

story:
Prism Shaped Foldable, Disposable, Sticky Fly Trap

(I hold a 1 year patent)

MY FLY TRAP IS A BETTER LOOKING VERSION OF THE TYPICAL FLY RIBBON THAT CATCHES FLIES IN YOUR HOME USING A STICKY FLY ATTRACTANT ONLY MY DESIGN HIDES THE GROSS DEAD FLIES FROM SIGHT!

WHO WANTS A DISGUSTING FLY STRIP FULL OF DEAD FLIES HANGING IN THEIR HOUSE WHEN YOU COULD HAVE MY DESIGNER LOOKING FLY TRAP?

THE PRICES ARE SIMILAR AND ALSO WORKS WELL. IT COMES PACKAGED FLAT AND IS DISPOSABLE. ALSO HAS HOLES FOR THE FLIES TO CRAWL THROUGH TO ACCESS THE STICKY GLUE.

SIMPLY  PEEL AWAY THE PROTECTIVE LAYER TO REVEAL THE STICKY GLUE, FOLD INTO SHAPE ALONG THE  CORRUGATED LINES, ADHERE THE EDGES WITH THE DOUBLE SIDED TAPED EDGE, THEN HANG. TOSS IN THE GARBAGE WHEN IT'S DONE!


A FEW DESIGNS BELOW:


HANGING IN THE TOP LEFT CORNER OF THE ROOM:

HANGING IN THE TOP RIGHT CORNER OF ANOTHER ROOM:




  FLIES TRAPPED INSIDE


How It Became:

My parents used to have a manure farm close to their neighborhood which attracted a lot of flies as you could imagine and they would always hang these ugly fly strip from ceiling fans or light fixtures that were filled with tonnes of nasty dead flies. It was gross!


After walking into one and getting disgusting sticky dead fly glue in my hair I came up with the idea to make a sticky fly trap that hides the dead flies out of sight. I also wanted it to look good hanging in your house!

The Design Process:

So I went to into Staples to look at some patterns and colors I could use to start making some prototypes and decided to go with these to start.



I actually first started with a cylindrical shape that I just rolled into shape and glued shut after punching holes in it for the flies to crawl through.


Then I cam up with the prism shaped one that's more attractive than the cylinder and just as easy to fold into shape from flat. 

The prototypes I have made so far that you see in the pictures here have your "typical" sticky fly strip cut into strips and glued to the designer construction paper I chose. I pre-punched the holes for the flies to access the sticky fly attractant inside when folded together. Then folded it into the prism shape and added double sided tape along the seem to join both edges. Ten hung some string and I was done.

I tested a few sizes and found this looked the best and offered the same sticky glue surface area as fly ribbon.


It can also sit flat like this on a window sill if you prefer that to hanging it.


So I made up a dozen and shipped them out to a friend in India where flies run rampant most months of the year. It was winter here in Vancouver so I had no way of testing them to see if they actually caught flies. 

After a few weeks my friend send me some photos he took after hanging some of my fly traps in his house in India.

Here they are.



So I was extremely happy to see they did work! And well!

The Plan:

Now I just need to get jigs and molds made to manufacture them!

I have a provisional patent but need a full patent which is approximately $9000.

The finished product will come packaged flat so they can be stacked in boxes like paper and take up very little shelf space in the store and are good for storage.

They will have a peel away protective layer covering the sticky glue and a peel away sticky edge to fold the prism into shape.

The fold lines will be perforated for easy folding and the exterior shell will come in many different patterns and colors.

They will be disposable and cheap to make and buy. (approximately $1.50 - $2.50 each retail). Just use and throw away every few weeks.

That is the goal and with your pledges we can reach it!

Let's make catching flies more attractive!

story: Probably all of you remember that two years ago, Citybirds has presented neo orange minimalistic kick scooter called Pigeon. Today we just got back from a Trip of the lifetime around Europe. During which we were delivering Pigeons to the people who backed the successfully funded kickstarter project. While making attempts not to stop at what has been achieved with a Pigeon we do our best to show our clear position on the impact of ecology on human life. Therefore, we are super excited to introduce you to Raven the lightest scooter on a market! The main idea of Raven scooter was to try changing an elementary behavior of an item as such and to attempt making it more classy, more subtle and more user-friendly, and handy to use. Therefore the Raven kick scooter folds with a single movement of a foot. Its users just need to press the pedal with a foot and that is that. So it is absolutely comfortable to use. Since we wanted to expand our target group and to create a trend which would involve businessmen to be a part of this eco-friendly vehicle movement, we have chosen carbon fiber material for its luxuriance, stability and lightness. Moreover, we designed an orange gap in the middle of horizontal frame to enable folding of the whole scooter to an absolute flat-pack stick which does not take much space. The streamlined shape of the Raven perfectly fits the user’s shoulder therefore it is possible to carry it easily when the scooter is folded. Finally, our main ambition is to change an approach of the people throughout the world towards the things that seem unchangeable and to replace rushing with a pleasant and useful process. We believe in the idea of creating a better everyday life for you – in the idea of your own luxury.

Today we just got back from a Trip of the lifetime around Europe. During which we were delivering Pigeons to the people who backed the successfully funded kickstarter project. While making attempts not to stop at what has been achieved with a Pigeon we do our best to show our clear position on the impact of ecology on human life. Therefore, we are super excited to introduce you to Raven the lightest scooter on a market! The main idea of Raven scooter was to try changing an elementary behavior of an item as such and to attempt making it more classy, more subtle and more user-friendly, and handy to use. Therefore the Raven kick scooter folds with a single movement of a foot. Its users just need to press the pedal with a foot and that is that. So it is absolutely comfortable to use. Since we wanted to expand our target group and to create a trend which would involve businessmen to be a part of this eco-friendly vehicle movement, we have chosen carbon fiber material for its luxuriance, stability and lightness. Moreover, we designed an orange gap in the middle of horizontal frame to enable folding of the whole scooter to an absolute flat-pack stick which does not take much space. The streamlined shape of the Raven perfectly fits the user’s shoulder therefore it is possible to carry it easily when the scooter is folded. Finally, our main ambition is to change an approach of the people throughout the world towards the things that seem unchangeable and to replace rushing with a pleasant and useful process. We believe in the idea of creating a better everyday life for you – in the idea of your own luxury.

story:
Si te apasiona el agua, la pesca, la playa, la natación, el buceo 

 

 solo es la primera de las novedades, dentro de poco veréis muchas. en abril 2016 estaremos otra vez 
aquí

 

 

                 ----- SISTEMAS DE PROPULSIÓN ACUÁTICA (sin motor)----------

   

 sistema integrado es el mas fácil, barato, seguro, silencioso y ecológico que existe. pero también el mejor que puede utilizar un niño o una persona con cualquier limitación funcional.

Propulsión acuática es importante en el agua, pero cuando hablamos de embarcaciones (para todas las edades) la seguridad es aún más importante. Hemos hecho que sea aún más fácil.

 

 

 

 

Las primeras pruebas se realizaron con niños (porque eran lo más difícil) mediante la instalación de nuestro propulsor en hinchables comunes .

    ----- SISTEMAS DE PROPULSION ACUATICA (sin motor)----------

                  

 

No existe ningún sistema de propulsión acuática mejor, mas fácil de utilizar, que ofrezca mayor capacidad de propulsión, consiga controlar el rumbo sin timón, que pueda integrarse en un vehículo acuático (Formar parte de el) y además facilite la sujeción del usuario.

                                                 

Seguro, silencioso y ecológico que existe. pero también el mejor que puede utilizar un niño o una persona con cualquier limitación funcional.      

 

 

 

 

 

No puede ser más fácil!

 

 

Una embarcación casi perfecta, con un muy bajo centro de gravedad, un frente fácilmente cambiable y el eje de balance positivo lado, para superar o navegar a través de las pequeñas olas con facilidad. No hay ninguna embarcaciones sin motor tan fácil de usar. Un día en la playa o dar un paseo por un lago en la compañía de sus amigos, a sus hijos, o nietos, es una experiencia inolvidable, ya que es muy fácil para cualquier niño de 3 años de edad. Nunca te dejará colgado porque USTED es su combustible .

 

 

Montar junto con otros MOTIOBOAT, hablar sin tener que gritar, compitiendo para ver quién llega primero o jugar con una pelota, sin descarga de la batería, ya que no tiene y no lo necesita.

 

 

 

No te lo pierdas, si quieres disfrutar de esta espectacular innovación de este verano.
 

 

 

los primeros en comprar un MOTIOBOAT  recibirá  un exclusivo diseño MOTIOBOAT camiseta.   Somos personas innovadoras y trabajadores, esto es sólo el comienzo.

 

                                      

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Me encantan las actividades de agua. Me gustaría ayudar a hacer actividades acuáticas no motorizadas más divertido, pero sobre todo, más seguro para todas las edades.

ESTE PRIMER PROYECTO no salio bien, pero ya estamos trabajando.

story:
M'name's Krystine

My youngest brother, Andrew is a survivor of Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma. He was four when he was diagnosed with a non lymphoblastic tumour on his forehead. He started chemotherapy a month later. Andrew underwent twenty five months of treatment. Fast forward to 2012, Andrew is 11 years off treatment (this October). 

I'm riding in the Ottawa Hospital Fondation's Ride the Rideau to honour him. 

Ride the Rideau

Ride the Rideau is a 100 km metric century bike ride from Ottawa to Merrikvale. Last year, I volunteered with Starbucks' cheer stations. This year, I am riding! I will be posting updates of my training schedule. 

I would greatly appreciate any and all donations towards my fundraising minimum of $1500. My riding team has a total goal of $30 000. All donations wil be forwarded to the Ottawa Hospital Research Insitute.

I have an amazing opportunity through my work (I'm a Starbucks Barista) to connect with people everyday and am encouraged to get involved in my community. In addition to all that I fundraise, Starbucks Make Your Mark will also be making a contribution. Baristas who are not up to riding the 100 km to Merrickville will be stationed along the way cheering the rest of us on! 

The Impact

**taken from http://www.ridetherideau.ca/raising-funds-for-o...

In just two years, Ride the Rideau has raised an incredible $2.7M for cancer research at the Ottawa Hospital Research Institute (OHRI). This funding has helped us build the new Centre for Innovative Cancer Research, a unique, world-class laboratory that is enabling our researchers to rapidly move their discoveries into the clinic to benefit patients. Ride the Rideau has also helped our researchers develop and test promising new therapies, such as cancer-fighting viruses that target tumours without harming normal tissues. Support for clinical trials has also increased, ensuring that patients in Ottawa will continue to have access to the newest cancer treatments. You can be sure, however, that the benefits of this research are felt not only in Ottawa, but also around the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

Anything and everything helps. If you are unable to contribute financially, Ride the Rideau is looking for volunteers. I would also greatly appreciate it if you could share this on Facebook, Twitter, Google+ and the like!

story:
Car Emotion is the only system on the market, which is able to detect signs of life inside a vehicle. This game changer development has clearly proven its ability to send a warning via text message, 60 seconds after the driver exits the vehicle, in any situation where a child is left behind. In such a situation, the driver is very likely to still be near the vehicle.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to raise $240,000, in order to advance from the prototype stage to industrial production. The investment will enable us to develop the engineering features of the device, which serves as the “heart of the system” in the vehicle, establish interfaces to the sensor systems, develop electronic circuits, develop software systems and reduce the size of the product to the size of a smartphone. It will be designed and adapted so that it can be installed conveniently and integrated into any private vehicle, and, in the future, be incorporated into every vehicle that leaves the production line.
  • We are determined to manufacture the product, even if we do not succeed in raising the required amount through the Indigogo crowdfunding platform. Unfortunately, in that case, development and production will take longer.
  • For 100$ you get a perfect Car Emotion Unit with warranty & service for 1 year!
  • The campaign is designed to enable the Company, within a period of about six months, to advance from the present prototype stage and to start mass production. We invite you to invest in the system, at cost price, so that your donation will save children's lives, worldwide.

    The Impact

    • Through crowdfunding, we want to change the “rules of the game,” according to which every case of forgetting a child in a vehicle on a hot day could end tragically. We currently have a solution that does not exist anywhere else in the world: the ability to identify “‘signs of life” in a vehicle. Installation of the system is a life-saver that could prevent irreversible harm to children, incapacitated people or animals, all over the world. Anyone who has forgotten a child for even a few moments knows that even once is sometimes too often. How much are you prepared to give, to prevent you or others suffering this grief?
    • The system is ready and has passed all the tests. We have a prototype. The Chief Scientist of the State of Israel has been convinced and is making a significant contribution to the project. Dr. Gadi Shvetz and Dr. Boris Greenstein have, in the past, successfully developed systems for locating life underground. Car-Emotion's system provides a conclusive indication in 100% of cases.
    • So now, between us and the ability to save lives all over the world, stands the sum of $240,000. If a thousand people all over the world believe in the system and donate $100 each – we will reach our goal!

    Risks & Challenges

    • Three years ago, we embarked on a global mission involving two disciplines: on the one hand, a basic solution, without buttons, to alert us to any mistake that could lead to disaster. On the other hand – the world of mathematics and algorithms. On the way, we managed to combine the two, and today we have a winning product. At first we invested a lot of time, then we invested hundreds of hours of work and in the advanced stages we invested money.
    • Our team combined decades of learning in CIS countries, experience gained in one of the best armies in the world, and energy that is full of love for people, for parents and for children. We believe in our venture and we hope you will join us and support us. The Sanhedrin, the Supreme Religious Court that operated in the Land of Israel 1500 years ago, ruled that “every person created in the world is single and unique, and therefore anyone who saves a life, it is considered as if he saved an entire world.”
    • As far as we are concerned, even if we do not succeed in reaching the funding goal through Indigogo, we will continue with the belief that we will be able to save lives.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    The Save 1 Child Project, founded by the Rambam Health Care Campus and Dr. Gadi Shvetz, is a global support movement dedicated to promoting acts of kindness and saving children’s lives, regardless of their religion. The Association was established in cooperation with the Rambam Health Care Campus in Israel, which treats Jews, Muslims and Christians, regardless of their religion or origin. The Association cooperates with organizations and individuals who promote the values of humanity and family life in order to save children, alleviate their suffering, and safeguard their physical and mental health. For every set of 10$ Save a Child button flap that we sell, we will transfer 2$ to the Rambam Health Care Campus.

    • To summarize, even if you aren’t interested in buying a Car-Emotion System for yourself, you can still be partners in saving lives. Donate $9.99 and receive Save 1 Child button flap. Because even once is sometimes too often, to forget a child in the car, 
    • Or – Order 5 button flap for $23.99.
    • Or – 10 button flap for $89.99.
    • Or - Order a Save 1 Child T-Shirt for 20$.

    PARTICIPATE

    • July 2017 – Completion of software development
    • August 2017 – Completion of reduced prototype development
    • September 2017 – Production of final product template
    • October 2017 – Running a pilot on a 100-vehicle sample
    • December 2017 – Transition to industrial production

    Car-Emotion’s CEO is Dr. Gadi Shvets, and the algorithm developer is Dr. Boris Greenstein.

    Dr. Gadi Shvets

    • Has commanded a number of Israel Defense Forces (IDF) computer units, has worked in the technology field for over 30 years, including in the IDF (automatic scheduling systems – Israeli Information Technology Association prize), command and control systems, and more. He is a colonel in the reserves, and an entrepreneur by nature.
    • For more than a decade, Dr. Gadi Shvets has worked as a developer and consultant in information systems and computing systems, and has provided technological solutions in various fields for a variety of companies, including IBM, and in the aerospace industry, banks, the Scouts movement, and more. Previously, he served as CEO of Calanit Carmon, a public company with 400 employees in the field of systems development and support. Dr. Shvets retired from active army service with the rank of Colonel in 2000, after serving as commander of two computer units and as assistant to the commander of the Teleprocessing Corps. He has a bachelor's degree in statistics and performance analysis, and an MBA in business management.

    Dr. Boris Greenstein

    • Dr. Boris Greenstein is an internationally-renowned seismology expert, who has been a partner in various life-saving projects. His experience includes the development of seismic systems for the identification of landslides, and the development of algorithms for seismic analysis in various fields – including security developments to identify security threats in the protection of oil and gas pipelines, the identification of tunnels, and working as a consultant for Elbit. Dr. Greenstein holds a bachelor's degree in radio‑engineering and a Ph.D. in electronics. He is the key developer of the algorithm for the identification of “signs of life,” which has been patented in the United States.

story:
We believe that an electric folding bike gives you unlimited freedom in cities. Take it everywhere, make it part of you!

The VELLO BIKE is a high-performance folding bike that has been developed for the perfect urban cycling experience. Built for people with a fast-paced lifestyle who don’t want to be slowed down by the restrictions of a conventional bicycle.

We have put a lot of thought into developing a folding bike without any compromise to its riding performance: top-quality components combined with new technologies, an exclusive and award-winning design and various specially developed innovations guarantee a comfortable ride in the city. Thanks to its small fold, it can be transported easily onto public transport systems and placed under a desk or in a suitcase for travel. 

 A high-performance folding bike that provides a great riding experience 

Wheel it around 

Put it under your office desk 

 Put one or more VELLO BIKES in the trunk  

Just fold it in a few seconds to fit into a standard Samsonite suitcase for travel. There is no need to disassemble the bike, just fold it.

 

Visibility is very important to us: all our bikes have integrated LED lights in the front and rear clamp. All our bikes have the necessary reflectors on pedals and wheels. We also supply front and rear reflectors, and there are a number of VELLO accessories available for purchase in our online shop.

A variety of accessories - integrated lights, mudguards, front and rear carriers, kickstand and much more!

Carbon Drive Belt and Hydraulic Disk Brakes options

Hands-free and safe-locking magnetic folding!

Thanks to a self-locking magnet-release system, it folds quickly and easily and can be wheeled around or made to fit seamlessly into small spaces.

The breakthrough technology allows the battery to recharge on the energy generated while cycling, so you don’t need to dismantle it at the end of your ride and you will not run out of battery power. 

E-bike technology has been changing fast, and you’ll still find a lot of blogs dated from only a couple of years ago saying that you can only extend the range through regenerative braking for up to 10 percent and that generally self-charging e-bike technology is not possible. We are changing this with the VELLO BIKE+ as it allows up to 100% recharging while riding the bike. 

The energy with this new system is harvested as before by braking and pedaling, just that it now also converts mechanical energy into electrical energy thanks to the Integrated Kinetic Energy Recovery System (KERS). In that way, additional energy is released to recharge the light integrated lithium-ion battery. Through this new technology, VELLO BIKE+ all-in-one changes the motor map automatically and continuously in order to keep the battery charged. The motor assistance and the cutoff speed both depend on the battery charge, the input from the pedals (speed-torque) and the road slope.

Choose from different assistance levels to get the extra push you need with the 250W motor. It is electrically-assisted when you want it to be. Unlike most electric bikes, it is still easy to pedal even with the power assistance turned off.

You can ride up to 15 miles per hour (25 km/hour) for unlimited mileage in "self-charging mode", or in "turbo mode" for approx. 30 miles (50 km) on a full charge without any effort. As soon as you stop pedaling, the motor will stop pushing. The generated power depends on several factors including the bike speed, the pedaling speed, the road slope and the selected power mode.

 Plug in the charger after you use the bike in "turbo mode" only.

The charger is for free and always comes complementary together with your bike. The full charging time is 3 hours. 

By connecting your VELLO bike+ to your smart phone through Bluetooth, you can easily set the appropriate mode for the pedal assistance as well as plan bicycle routes.  

CONNECT it to:

  • Lock the rear wheel making it very difficult to pedal and harder to steal (available when the batter charge is greater than 20%)
  • See the custom dashboard and change power modes 
  • Get GPS tracking

Information on the dashboard:

  • Bike speed
  • Total/Partial odometer
  • Road slope
  • Motor Power
  • Charge status of the battery in percentage
  • Active power mode (you can also switch between power modes while on the go)
  • Warning icon

We produce all our bikes in our manufacturing facility in Vienna, Austria

Our VELLO bike consists of many components, some of which are our own inventions. Many of our technical developments can be considered pioneering design solutions in the bike industry and have been awarded patents.

Making the VELLO bike is not an easy task and requires close attention to detail: we've been working over the years with engineers and designers to make it ready for manufacturing with the care needed to make it the perfect folding bike. The process involved drawing, redrawing, modeling, remodeling, building and rebuilding, testing and retesting. We now have a high-quality folding bike for which we can offer a

5 year warranty on the frame and fork.

OUR MISSION

We believe that every one of us can contribute positively to our environment through our actions and products that we build. VELLO BIKE is a climate: active partner, a Climate Protection Initiative of Austria's Ministry of Environment with the aim of reducing the level of CO2 emission until 2020 (and beyond). Through this program, we can actively take part in shaping Austria's climate change policies. We are proud to do our share, and to contribute to a healthier and cleaner world.

VELLO BIKE is committed to...

  • reduce the carbon footprint by optimizing the production process continuously; 
  • strive to use resources efficiently and, where possible, to use locally sourced parts in order to minimize carbon emission; 
  • abide by the waste management regulations as well as all other environment legislation in Europe, and to prevent waste as best as possible. 

Furthermore, VELLO BIKE...

  • aims at achieving a long-term, sustainable production process;
  • provides its employees with VELLO bikes as a means for transport to and from work; 
  • gives back to society as made possible by our clients.

Manufacturing of the VELLO bike frames

VELLO bike was awarded the prestigious design award Red Dot: Best of the Best 2015, including for the category bicycle design.

This is how we started in 2013. From left to right: Valentin, the lead designer who loves fast-moving things (including his bundle of energy to the left). Then there's Valerie, she's the grand master of stuff. Paris and Jakob to her left have been on our side throughout the development. In the meantime, we have extended our team with Joachim who's in charge of customer service, and Christian, who's been doing a lot of the technical drawings for VELLO BIKE+.

The first prototype was developed in preparation for a trip to Cuba in 2010, and that was followed by many more developments and prototypes. For Valerie it was clear, it needed to be a folding bike for which she doesn't need to bend nor open any complicated hinges (hands-free folding) - AND - it needs to ride well like any other non-folding bike. What a challenge.

 

We were able to produce our first series of VELLO BIKE in November 2014 after a successful Kickstarter campaign. We received so much positive feedback from our backers and always love to get fan mail and pictures. Here's one with the Rocky in California:

 VELLO bikes are ridden in many places in the world...

 ...in London

 ...in Thailand

We have been selling our three existing models (Urbano, Rocky and Speedster - all non electric) successfully for the past year through selected retailers and our online shop. Next to this, we have continued developing the electric version, which was launched online through Kickstarter and physically with the first prototype at the Eurobike fair in Germany in September 2016.

http://facebook.com/vellobike
http://instagram.com/vellobike
http://twitter.com/vellobike

DOWNLOAD OUR PRESS KIT: http://download.press.vello.bike

Frequently Asked Questions

It is hard to recognize that VELLO bike+ is an electric bike. I see the motor in the rear hub, but where is the battery?

The battery is integrated in the hub situated on the back wheel together with the motor and the electronics (all-in-one integrated system). 

How do you control the electric bike?

In total, there are 6 power modes ranging from the fully powered-up turbo mode to the hybrid mode BIKE+ that keeps the battery charged at all times. The turbo mode is the power mode that you will find on a regular pedelec (Electric Pedal Assisted Bicycle). The motor assists then up to 25km/h with a maximum power of 250 W.

What kind of app does it use to connect to the phone?

 The bitride app allows to connect through a wide range of devices via bluetooth. Your VELLO BIKE+ is within this range of high tech devices! The app is free-of-charge and can be downloaded through the Apple Store or Google Play.

How does it help when I connect VELLO BIKE+ via bluetooth?

- GPS tracking

- Locking the rear wheel making it very difficult to pedal (available when the batter charge is greater than 20%)

- Custom dashboard and changing power modes (see next point)

 What kind of information does the dashboard on my screen provide?

- Total/Partial odometer

- Road slope

- Motor Power

- State of charge of the battery in percentage

- Active power mode (you can also switch between power modes while on the go)

- Warning icon

Can I ride the bike without the smartphone?

Yes, you can! Your VELLO BIKE+ will remember your favourite settings so you can get the best experience out of it. 

Can I still ride the bike when the power mode is turned off?

Yes, you can. Even when the regenerative braking is turned off, you can continue to ride the VELLO BIKE+ in the same way as a non-electric folding bike that is lightweight and easily foldable.

Can I buy bike accessories, like mudguards or other components, for the VELLO bike?

Yes, we have mudguards and a number of accessories already in our webshop at http://vello.bike and we’re continuously increasing the choices. 

What is the maximum recommended weight of the rider?

We recommend that the rider’s weight should be under 110kg (242 lbs) including luggage.

What if I'm very tall, can I ride it comfortably?

If you are above 1,95m, please let us now so we can adapt the bike with a special seatpost and handlebar post.

Do you also have a non-electric version of this bike?

Yes, we do. The VELLO BIKE with this fold will be available in our webshop http://vello.bike as of April 2018.

Can the all-in-one hub (providing the electrical assistance) be removed?

The rear wheel that includes the 3-in-1 hub is detachable and can be replaced with one that does not have the pedal assistance.

 See Indiegogo’s refund policy.
story_txt:
VELLO BIKE IS SHIPPING!

THE REVOLUTIONARY SELF-CHARGING FOLDING E-BIKE

 
    We believe that an electric folding bike gives you unlimited freedom in cities. Take it everywhere, make it part of you!The VELLO BIKE is a high-performance folding bike that has been developed for the perfect urban cycling experience. Built for people with a fast-paced lifestyle who don’t want to be slowed down by the restrictions of a conventional bicycle.We have put a lot of thought into developing a folding bike without any compromise to its riding performance: top-quality components combined with new technologies, an exclusive and award-winning design and various specially developed innovations guarantee a comfortable ride in the city. Thanks to its small fold, it can be transported easily onto public transport systems and placed under a desk or in a suitcase for travel.  A high-performance folding bike that provides a great riding experience Wheel it around Put it under your office desk  Put one or more VELLO BIKES in the trunk  Just fold it in a few seconds to fit into a standard Samsonite suitcase for travel. There is no need to disassemble the bike, just fold it. Visibility is very important to us: all our bikes have integrated LED lights in the front and rear clamp. All our bikes have the necessary reflectors on pedals and wheels. We also supply front and rear reflectors, and there are a number of VELLO accessories available for purchase in our online shop.
A variety of accessories - integrated lights, mudguards, front and rear carriers, kickstand and much more!Carbon Drive Belt and Hydraulic Disk Brakes optionsHands-free and safe-locking magnetic folding!Thanks to a self-locking magnet-release system, it folds quickly and easily and can be wheeled around or made to fit seamlessly into small spaces.The breakthrough technology allows the battery to recharge on the energy generated while cycling, so you don’t need to dismantle it at the end of your ride and you will not run out of battery power. E-bike technology has been changing fast, and you’ll still find a lot of blogs dated from only a couple of years ago saying that you can only extend the range through regenerative braking for up to 10 percent and that generally self-charging e-bike technology is not possible. We are changing this with the VELLO BIKE+ as it allows up to 100% recharging while riding the bike. The energy with this new system is harvested as before by braking and pedaling, just that it now also converts mechanical energy into electrical energy thanks to the Integrated Kinetic Energy Recovery System (KERS). In that way, additional energy is released to recharge the light integrated lithium-ion battery. Through this new technology, VELLO BIKE+ all-in-one changes the motor map automatically and continuously in order to keep the battery charged. The motor assistance and the cutoff speed both depend on the battery charge, the input from the pedals (speed-torque) and the road slope.Choose from different assistance levels to get the extra push you need with the 250W motor. It is electrically-assisted when you want it to be. Unlike most electric bikes, it is still easy to pedal even with the power assistance turned off.You can ride up to 15 miles per hour (25 km/hour) for unlimited mileage in "self-charging mode", or in "turbo mode" for approx. 30 miles (50 km) on a full charge without any effort. As soon as you stop pedaling, the motor will stop pushing. The generated power depends on several factors including the bike speed, the pedaling speed, the road slope and the selected power mode. Plug in the charger after you use the bike in "turbo mode" only.The charger is for free and always comes complementary together with your bike. The full charging time is 3 hours. By connecting your VELLO bike+ to your smart phone through Bluetooth, you can easily set the appropriate mode for the pedal assistance as well as plan bicycle routes.  CONNECT it to:
Lock the rear wheel making it very difficult to pedal and harder to steal (available when the batter charge is greater than 20%)
See the custom dashboard and change power modes 
Get GPS tracking
Information on the dashboard:
Bike speed
Total/Partial odometer
Road slope
Motor Power
Charge status of the battery in percentage
Active power mode (you can also switch between power modes while on the go)
Warning icon
We produce all our bikes in our manufacturing facility in Vienna, AustriaOur VELLO bike consists of many components, some of which are our own inventions. Many of our technical developments can be considered pioneering design solutions in the bike industry and have been awarded patents.Making the VELLO bike is not an easy task and requires close attention to detail: we've been working over the years with engineers and designers to make it ready for manufacturing with the care needed to make it the perfect folding bike. The process involved drawing, redrawing, modeling, remodeling, building and rebuilding, testing and retesting. We now have a high-quality folding bike for which we can offer a5 year warranty on the frame and fork.OUR MISSIONWe believe that every one of us can contribute positively to our environment through our actions and products that we build. VELLO BIKE is a climate: active partner, a Climate Protection Initiative of Austria's Ministry of Environment with the aim of reducing the level of CO2 emission until 2020 (and beyond). Through this program, we can actively take part in shaping Austria's climate change policies. We are proud to do our share, and to contribute to a healthier and cleaner world.VELLO BIKE is committed to...
reduce the carbon footprint by optimizing the production process continuously; 
strive to use resources efficiently and, where possible, to use locally sourced parts in order to minimize carbon emission; 
abide by the waste management regulations as well as all other environment legislation in Europe, and to prevent waste as best as possible. 
Furthermore, VELLO BIKE...
aims at achieving a long-term, sustainable production process;
provides its employees with VELLO bikes as a means for transport to and from work; 
gives back to society as made possible by our clients.
 

Manufacturing of the VELLO bike frames 
VELLO bike was awarded the prestigious design award Red Dot: Best of the Best 2015, including for the category bicycle design.This is how we started in 2013. From left to right: Valentin, the lead designer who loves fast-moving things (including his bundle of energy to the left). Then there's Valerie, she's the grand master of stuff. Paris and Jakob to her left have been on our side throughout the development. In the meantime, we have extended our team with Joachim who's in charge of customer service, and Christian, who's been doing a lot of the technical drawings for VELLO BIKE+.The first prototype was developed in preparation for a trip to Cuba in 2010, and that was followed by many more developments and prototypes. For Valerie it was clear, it needed to be a folding bike for which she doesn't need to bend nor open any complicated hinges (hands-free folding) - AND - it needs to ride well like any other non-folding bike. What a challenge.One of our first prototypes at our trip to Cuba in 2010 We were able to produce our first series of VELLO BIKE in November 2014 after a successful Kickstarter campaign. We received so much positive feedback from our backers and always love to get fan mail and pictures. Here's one with the Rocky in California: VELLO bikes are ridden in many places in the world... ...in London ...in ThailandWe have been selling our three existing models (Urbano, Rocky and Speedster - all non electric) successfully for the past year through selected retailers and our online shop. Next to this, we have continued developing the electric version, which was launched online through Kickstarter and physically with the first prototype at the Eurobike fair in Germany in September 2016.http://facebook.com/vellobikehttp://instagram.com/vellobikehttp://twitter.com/vellobikeDOWNLOAD OUR PRESS KIT: http://download.press.vello.bikeFrequently Asked QuestionsIt is hard to recognize that VELLO bike+ is an electric bike. The turbo mode is the power mode that you will find on a regular pedelec (Electric Pedal Assisted Bicycle). The motor assists then up to 25km/h with a maximum power of 250 W.What kind of app does it use to connect to the phone? The bitride app allows to connect through a wide range of devices via bluetooth. Your VELLO BIKE+ is within this range of high tech devices! The app is free-of-charge and can be downloaded through the Apple Store or Google Play.How does it help when I connect VELLO BIKE+ via bluetooth?- GPS tracking- Locking the rear wheel making it very difficult to pedal (available when the batter charge is greater than 20%)- Custom dashboard and changing power modes (see next point) What kind of information does the dashboard on my screen provide?- Total/Partial odometer- Road slope- Motor Power- State of charge of the battery in percentage- Active power mode (you can also switch between power modes while on the go)- Warning iconCan I ride the bike without the smartphone?Yes, you can! story:
Anyway is an application primarily focusing on giving public transit, bicycling and walking directions around the world.

But why do we need another service for that? There are solutions for that from Google, Apple and Microsoft! But there is one problem with all of them: they just work in big city's! (and even there not so great)

What we want to do is build a crowed sourced service that enables anyone to go online and contribute data to the service to make it truly worldwide, always up-do-date and every time suggest the best way to go.

As more data we collect as more valid information can we offer, like the price of a bus ticket, the best way to go - depending on the weather or more vehicles like bikes, inline-skates or whatever idea you have.

To help creating this thing we need money to finance equipment and professional software engineers.

As we are in the makeing of this service, you can always see the progress that we ourselfes and all of us as a community do and we will always keep you up-to-date and answer all questions.

We would be extremely happy to build this service with your help and future engagement and everything of that will lead to an amazing application - in Anyway ;)

Vincent 


How you can help?


   money             join the team         create


How does it work?

The service consists out of two parts, the one is for creating and editing the maps and the other one is the actual end-user application.

1. the creator 

In the creator everyone willing to help can edit the maps and create new routes or places.

2. the app

-Every user can use the app to find their way to a certain location (address, business, contact, event, etc ...) with either their foots, their car, their bicycle or with public transit.

-As well as finding the right way with anyway you can also <<take the way as your destination>> and find great routes to walk in the mountains or jog or for a city tour.

-And with anyway you can always manage your movements, the number of steps, the calories burned or miles walked. It can even pair with fitness accessories to get even better results

story:
My name is Jessica and I'm in training to bike over 400 miles across Zambia (starting June 24, 2014) to raise funds and awareness for four amazing orgs saving lives and fighting poverty in Zambia:

  • World Bicycle Relief 
  • The Centre for Infectious Disease Research in Zambia (CIDRZ) 
  • Sishemo Education Trust 
  • Grassroot Soccer 

This campaign is to help me actually get to Zambia! 


Tickets are close to $2k, and with my birthday coming up (March 8th), I'm hoping my friends and family (and extremely kind total strangers) instead of buying me a card or a drink this year, will pitch in a few dollars to help me on this mission to fight poverty & AIDS in Zambia! 


I'm trying to fundraise for half the cost of a flight, and there is no collective gift I can think of that would make me happier! 


You can also support the four non-profits mentioned above through my Bike Zambia campaign on Chooda.org ( I still have over $1k to raise). All proceeds there go to the non-profits. Here's what biking across Zambia is like!


(Note: If you've already supported me on my Bike Zambia campaign or plan to, you will get the same awesome thank you items as are mentioned here!) 


Please share with your friends and family, and THANK YOU! xoxo - Jessica (Jesi)

story:
Introducing myself

Hello! My name is Guillaume, and I'm a 16 years old student from the south of France. I study Science of Enineering (which include Mechanical and Electrical Engineering). I'm an ambitious and passionate student, who believe great ideas can change the face of the world, and who hope to make something big, someday. I get some revenues from applications I build for people, and from my apps advertising incomes. I'm also an Apple WWDC 2013 Student Scholarship recipient (learn more about it here). You can also check out my portfolio!


The Project: Genesis

        Almost a year ago, I came up with an idea. While I was flying my Parrot A.R.Drone, I wondered: Why isn't there such a vehicle for the human ? So I made researches on the actual advancement of the idea. I didn't find any system implementing that solution, so I assumed it couldn't be achieved, maybe because of the insufficient thrust capacity of such a small system. However, after a few other searches, I found a formulae, proving that it actually could be achieved. After a functional analysis of the pros and cons of the system, I came to the conclusion that it was totally possible. Plus, the development of the concept would be easier since it has a lot in common with the motorcycle and other transports. 



Its development

        This is the actual point when I started to get into it. After drawing a few concept art to have an idea of the final product's appearance, the first aspect of it that I focused on was the Electrical Treatment Unit, which groups all the sensors and the controlling unit. This part being cheap enough, and with chances that it wouldn't work, I did it independently, at my own costs. It worked just as I expected, every component properly works as part of the system.

I have also conceptualized the vehicle, using softwares such as Autodesk Inventor, Sketchbook, Proteus ISIS and other modeling and simulation tools.



Photograph of the ETU (sensors for user input, external conditions, GPS tracking, brakes servomotors, gyroscopic breakout, ultrasonic distance sensor etc.) 



What's needed and what you will get

Now, as I'm getting closer to the building of the full size prototype, I realize that as a student, I'll need way more funds in order to get everything done properly. I have made a chart to show the expenses and their cost. *



UPDATE:

  • Mechanical Engineering & Machining (gears, helixes, differentials, etc.) = 2000$
  • Electro-mechanical parts (electric motor, brake systems, etc) = 1500$
  • Electrical parts (sensors, microcontrollers, energy solutions, etc) = 1500$
  • Materials and tools (metal sheets, hard soldering set, etc) = 1000$
  • Legal expenses (patent, etc) = 3000$
  • Shipping fees and unexpected expenses = 1000$
*These outgoings have been conjectured by simulation on different resellers website.

Yes, but what do I get ?

Well, first and foremost, you're offering me a great chance to make my dream come true. Apart from that, I intend to apply to the Google Science Fair 2014, which is an incredible opportunity I recently heard about, not only for me: it will not only drive more attention to the idea, but it could also get me rid of the (financial) struggles of getting to college!

Take a look at the perks ! From personal thank you e-mails to digital dowloads, through discounts on the vehicle if it get manufactured, you'll probably find the one that fits you.


Future evolution

If the project works, what will happen next ?

The ultimate goal of the project is for the vehicle to reach the average customer, and become a common mean of transport. Thus, the hovercraft will be adapted, in order to be suitable for industrial manufacturing. It will be designed to be as affordable, environment and user friendly as possible.



Many other ways to help!

Financial contribution isn't the only way to help the project growing ! You can also:

  1. Spread the word, ask people to tell their friends, and so on! ;)
  2. Give a feedback on what I could make better, whether it be about my project, or the way I introduce it by leaving a comment.

story:
Short Summary

Last week a young boy in Temecula was hit by a car while riding his new bike on his birthday. Thankfully he was not injured seriously , however the accident damaged his bicycle beyond repair.  Currently his family can not afford to replace the bike. We need your help to raise 300 dollars in one week to purchase him a new bike and a helmet. Please donate whatever you can.


What We Need 

We need your help to raise $300 dollars in one week to purchase him a new bike and a helmet. Please donate whatever you can. The Indiegogo software solution we are using requires the campagin to set a goal of at least $500 dollars however we are confident we can make this boys day with just $300.

The Impact

You will make the day of a young boy in our community. 

Details

Cathy and Mitch Dunford are sponsoring this fundraiser. If you have any questions please feel free to contact one of them.

story:
Charge ahead with the M2S Bikes All Terrain 

 

The rugged aluminum alloy frame includes an integrated battery pack capable of delivering over 50 miles per charge using pedal assist or around 20 miles on throttle-only mode. The 4.5 inch fat tires easily cruise through the toughest terrain while absorbing bumps and soaking up holes with ease. High quality components are included throughout the bike and make this a premium electric bike offered at a great price for a limited time through our Kickstarter campaign.

Riders can take advantage of the powerful 750-watt rear hub motor to blast up steep hills and enjoy riding at speeds of up to 20 mph on throttle only mode while providing an extra boost to get you through the toughest types of terrain you can find.

 

Whether you're charging through soft sand, snow or city streets, the All Terrain is a great all-around bike that makes every ride fun and enjoyable.

The integrated battery pack and 8-speed Shimano gear set helps power riders up to 50+ miles per charge.

 

Standard Features On The All Terrain:

  • Powerful and reliable Bafang motors with two-year warranty
  • Panasonic 17 amp hour lithium ion batteries rated for 900+ charge cycles
  • Durable high-quality aluminum alloy frames
  • Zoom hydraulic disc brakes with motor cut off
  • Zoom handlebar and stem
  • Shimano 1x8 gear set and derailleur
  • Aluminum Alloy rims with extra-large tires (26” x 4.5")
  • Stem-Mounted LCD display
  • Multi-function control with thumb throttle
  • Choice of white or black paint
  • Smart battery charger system
  • Aluminum alloy pedals

Take advantage of the special discounted offer for a limited time and help us ramp up our production and bring this bike to the market this fall and in the process save over $1000 off full retail pricing.

Pricing breakdown: For a limited time we're offering continued discounts off full retail pricing through our Indiegogo InDemand campaign. Once the bikes have arrived and we have inventory in stock and can offer next day shipping, our pricing will increase to the full retail prices ($1950 non-suspension; $2250 suspension fork). 

Update on quantities and order status

Our first order of 20 bikes (10 suspension & 10 non-suspension) was placed in early September and is expected to arrive to the United States in mid-October to late October. Our second order of an additional 20 bikes is currently being processed and will be delivered in early November.

We will continue to provide updates on the availability of the bikes here and will update shipping dates as new information becomes available. Currently, we have a limited supply of bikes remaining for October delivery and are working to expedite the second shipment to ensure as fast as order delivery as possible.

Risks and challenges

With manufacturing currently underway and delivery of our first round of bikes expected for October, we're offering early supporters who want to pre-order the bikes a great opportunity to help us get our manufacturing up and running and get these bikes rolling off the assembly line as soon as possible. As with all manufacturing projects, certain risks and challenges could present themselves, but we are confident that our experience with our manufacturing partners will not present any insurmountable challenges. By supporting our efforts through a pre-order of one of our bikes you'll be getting in on the ground floor and taking advantage of the lowest prices that will ever be offered for these bikes. If you like what you see and want to learn more, feel free to reach out via m2sbikes@gmail.com or give us a call at 828-773-0738. Thanks for the support!
story_txt:
Charge ahead with the M2S Bikes All Terrain  The rugged aluminum alloy frame includes an integrated battery pack capable of delivering over 50 miles per charge using pedal assist or around 20 miles on throttle-only mode. The 4.5 inch fat tires easily cruise through the toughest terrain while absorbing bumps and soaking up holes with ease. High quality components are included throughout the bike and make this a premium electric bike offered at a great price for a limited time through our Kickstarter campaign.Riders can take advantage of the powerful 750-watt rear hub motor to blast up steep hills and enjoy riding at speeds of up to 20 mph on throttle only mode while providing an extra boost to get you through the toughest types of terrain you can find. Whether you're charging through soft sand, snow or city streets, the All Terrain is a great all-around bike that makes every ride fun and enjoyable.The integrated battery pack and 8-speed Shimano gear set helps power riders up to 50+ miles per charge. Standard Features On The All Terrain:
Powerful and reliable Bafang motors with two-year warranty
Panasonic 17 amp hour lithium ion batteries rated for 900+ charge cycles
Durable high-quality aluminum alloy frames
Zoom hydraulic disc brakes with motor cut off
Zoom handlebar and stem
Shimano 1x8 gear set and derailleur
Aluminum Alloy rims with extra-large tires (26” x 4.5")
Stem-Mounted LCD display
Multi-function control with thumb throttle
Choice of white or black paint
Smart battery charger system
Aluminum alloy pedals
