story:
The LIFEbike (Lightweight, Intelligent, Flexible, Electric bike) is designed to provide urban commuters with the most convenient, fun and easy way to get from A to B without breaking a sweat. As an electric bike, LIFEbike does not require a license or insurance to operate in most parts of the world.  Its compact design means it can be stored almost anywhere, making it ideal for small space living; it can easily fit into a closet or elevator to go from condo to office.  

 

 Click on the image above to see a 3D model of the production LIFEbike.

What’s the big deal?

LIFEbike has already won 4 Industrial Design awards and 2 Business Awards and is made in Canada. And actually, it’s the small stuff about the LIFEbike that makes it a big deal:

  • Upright riding position is easy and comfortable
  • The LIFEbike can be folded and unfolded in about 10 seconds.
  • LIFEbike is compact and chainless (and greaseless), so you can take it virtually anywhere you go. 
  • The LIFEbike design is simple to operate and is virtually maintenance-free.
  • LIFEbike costs only 5 cents a day to operate.
  • Its zero-emissions means it’s a green form a transportation.

With your help, we plan to bring this exciting, one-of-a-kind design to the market this fall.

The Buzz:

LIFEbike has already garnered several awards and much press coverage.

"LIFEbike takes a fresh approach to ebike design", Gizmag

"Henry Chong's electric bike keeps winning awards", Globe and Mail

"Revelo LIFEbike is a cool electric bike", Vehicle Passion

The Creator

Meet Henry Chong, an Industrial Designer and the creator of the LIFEbike.   A life-long lover of bicycles and design, Henry’s been a bike-commuter for over 35 years who appreciates the enormous sense of freedom and connection with his community when he’s on two-wheels.  With the latest advances in technology, electric bikes now make it possible for more people to travel by bike more often and redevelop the ties to their communities. 

Enter...the LIFEbike.

 “I decided to take a fresh approach to electric personal transport.  I felt that a vehicle with an iconic design would inspire people to think differently about their transportation options.   I wanted a design that would fit easily into people’s lives and into the existing infrastructure.  It had to be fun, easy to ride, practical, and look cool, of course!”

Mixing his industrial design background with his natural flair for art and design, Henry created the LIFEbike – a compact, affordable form of green personal transportation that offers freedom from congestion and costly transportation options.  And don’t forget: you look great riding it too. 

With your help we can take LIFEbike from prototype and put it in the hands of happy riders in the real world and encourage more people to embrace travel on 2-wheels.

 

LIFEbike will have an ultralight production weight, including battery, of near 15kgs, and can travel 30 kilometres on five cents worth of electricity. The lockable battery is easily detachable and charges like a laptop battery within 4 hours.  A simple twist of the thumb controlled throttle will allow the rider to reach a top speed of 25 km/h.  The unique ergonomic design lowers the center of gravity, is easier to ride, and enables an upright riding position that provides the rider with a clearer view of their surroundings for greater agility, confidence, and safety.

 

The patent pending front pedaling technology allows riders to dynamically switch the front wheel crank arms from a resting position for comfortable cruising to an active pedaling position. 

Under development is the storage system for the LIFEbike.  Here's a video of the prototype front mounting storage rack and pannier that I had loaded up with about 5 kg of groceries.  

 

 

 

We are working hard to meet these specifications as we begin production.  As we are in final prototype state, some of these specs might change slightly.

  • Frame and fork 6061 aluminum
  • Motor 250-watt geared brushless
  • Battery 36V 10Ah lithium
  • Length 114cm
  • Size, compacted 109cm x 30cm x 79cm
  • Weight 15.4 kg
  • Distance per charge 30 km (approx. 5 cents electricity)
  • Max speed 25km/h
  • Wheel size 20” front x 16” back

 

We have been refining our production prototype since the concept was first conceived 2 years ago.  We have tested the prototypes on over 170 riders ranging in age from 16 to 74 (see our Facebook fan page for the Test Riders gallery https://www.facebook.com/ReveloElectric).  Everyone was able to ride successfully on their very first try.

The design intent of the LIFEbike was to make it easy to maintain, easy to ride, great looking, lightweight, strong, safe, and contain common parts that are easy to replace. From our prototypes, we have completed our first manufacturing 3D model and have located a bike manufacturer in Canada to work with us.  

The first prototypes were hand-built by Henry and we look forward to putting the first manufactured prototypes through rigorous testing this summer.

The costs to get us to production are extensive and this is where we need your help. We are aiming to get the first limited edition LIFEbikes out this September.

Whenever Henry rides the LIFEbike, people always stop him and ask, "That's cool! Where can I get one?" With your help, we can complete the testing of our final prototypes and get them in the hands of happy riders like you very soon!

 

Your support is very much appreciated!!  These rewards have been developed with style and functionality in mind.

For $10, a Revelo reflective strip to wrap around your leg or arm for added safety.

For $15, a Revelo drawstring pack + Revelo reflective strip

For $40, Revelo Original Tee + Revelo drawstring pack + Revelo reflective strip:

For $60, Revelo Original Hoodie + Drawstring Pack + Reflective Strip: 

For $120, Fun and Freedom for a Day use of LIFEbike for two (available for Toronto region only)

For $200, Customize Your LIFEbike with choice of color

For $400, Layaway for General Availability LIFEbike + Tee

For $1500, Production Run LIFEbike.  Available November 2013.

For $1,800, Limited Edition LIFEbike. Early release and individually numbered. Ready Sept 2013.

For $2600, A pair of Production Run LIFEbikes to double the fun.  Available November 2013. 

All LIFEbikes will be backed by a 2 year warranty on parts and materials, and 1 year battery warranty.  Destination based delivery charge will apply at time of delivery. 

 

We are a team with a mission to revolutionize personal transportation with clean and efficient electric transportation alternatives that give people more fun and freedom.  We hope game changing designs like our LIFEbike will encourage more people to adopt greener modes of transportation, thus helping relieve our cities of congestion and empowering them to better explore and connect with their surroundings.

From Henry:

My passion lies within the intersection of human interaction, mobility systems and urban development.  With the emergence of the electric bike technology, I became a strong proponent of electric bikes as an immediately available, green and sustainable transportation option, especially for urban environments.

After a 20-year career in Information Technology, I decided to pursue my true passion to become an Industrial Designer and completed my degree from OCADU in 2011.  As a 35-year bicycle enthusiast and urban commuter, I focused my thesis project on the transportation needs of the urban commuter and created the LIFEbike. 

Realizing how empowering LIFEbike can be for so many, I founded Revelo Bikes Inc. in 2012 with a mission to create innovative, fun and highly usable personal electric vehicles that inspire and empower others to live life more fully. 

As a child immigrant to Canada, I am especially proud to present the LIFEbike as a designed-in-Canada solution and can’t wait to watch it revolutionize urban commuting around the world.

Revelo Bikes Inc. is a new Canadian company dedicated to revolutionizing personal transportation and we have received generous support from MaRS, OCE, OCADU, and Venture Start to help guide us through our development.

 

For all our supporters, we would like to engage you for your input as we further develop the LIFEbike.  We’ve already received enquiries and interest for the LIFEbike from around the world and for all types of use. We’ve been asked by major academic and industrial campuses to offer the LIFEbike as a campus bike; we’ve been asked by seniors who see this as a manageable, trusted, personal transportation companion; busy families see this as an affordable "2nd car;" others with mobility and balance concerns have suggested a tricycle version of the LIFEbike. 

With your contribution, we invite you to add your voice to this conversation as there is much impact that the LIFEbike can make, to lives, to communities, and to cities. 

Together, we can help reduce congestion, encourage the use of a greener form of transportation, and empower individuals by providing greater personal mobility.

"Gas prices continue to rise and people are looking for alternative methods of transportation.  The world continues to become a green, sustainable society and the LIFEbike is a perfect fit -  The Crowdfund Mafia "

Thank you!

 

 

Questions or comments – if you have a question, just post it as a comment and we will respond to it promptly.

Please see the campaign Gallery for the most up to date answers to the FAQs.
story_txt:
The LIFEbike (Lightweight, Intelligent, Flexible, Electric bike) is designed to provide urban commuters with the most convenient, fun and easy way to get from A to B without breaking a sweat. As an electric bike, LIFEbike does not require a license or insurance to operate in most parts of the world.  Its compact design means it can be stored almost anywhere, making it ideal for small space living; it can easily fit into a closet or elevator to go from condo to office.  
 
 Click on the image above to see a 3D model of the production LIFEbike.
What’s the big deal?
LIFEbike has already won 4 Industrial Design awards and 2 Business Awards and is made in Canada. And actually, it’s the small stuff about the LIFEbike that makes it a big deal:

Upright riding position is easy and comfortable

The LIFEbike can be folded and unfolded in about 10 seconds.
LIFEbike is compact and chainless (and greaseless), so you can take it virtually anywhere you go. 
The LIFEbike design is simple to operate and is virtually maintenance-free.
LIFEbike costs only 5 cents a day to operate.
Its zero-emissions means it’s a green form a transportation.
With your help, we plan to bring this exciting, one-of-a-kind design to the market this fall.
The Buzz:
LIFEbike has already garnered several awards and much press coverage.
"LIFEbike takes a fresh approach to ebike design", Gizmag
"Henry Chong's electric bike keeps winning awards", Globe and Mail
"Revelo LIFEbike is a cool electric bike", Vehicle Passion

The Creator
Meet Henry Chong, an Industrial Designer and the creator of the LIFEbike.   A life-long lover of bicycles and design, Henry’s been a bike-commuter for over 35 years who appreciates the enormous sense of freedom and connection with his community when he’s on two-wheels.  With the latest advances in technology, electric bikes now make it possible for more people to travel by bike more often and redevelop the ties to their communities. 

Enter...the LIFEbike.
 “I decided to take a fresh approach to electric personal transport.  I felt that a vehicle with an iconic design would inspire people to think differently about their transportation options.   I wanted a design that would fit easily into people’s lives and into the existing infrastructure.  It had to be fun, easy to ride, practical, and look cool, of course!”
Mixing his industrial design background with his natural flair for art and design, Henry created the LIFEbike – a compact, affordable form of green personal transportation that offers freedom from congestion and costly transportation options.  And don’t forget: you look great riding it too. 
With your help we can take LIFEbike from prototype and put it in the hands of happy riders in the real world and encourage more people to embrace travel on 2-wheels.
 

LIFEbike will have an ultralight production weight, including battery, of near 15kgs, and can travel 30 kilometres on five cents worth of electricity. The lockable battery is easily detachable and charges like a laptop battery within 4 hours.  A simple twist of the thumb controlled throttle will allow the rider to reach a top speed of 25 km/h.  The unique ergonomic design lowers the center of gravity, is easier to ride, and enables an upright riding position that provides the rider with a clearer view of their surroundings for greater agility, confidence, and safety.

 
The patent pending front pedaling technology allows riders to dynamically switch the front wheel crank arms from a resting position for comfortable cruising to an active pedaling position. 

Under development is the storage system for the LIFEbike.  Here's a video of the prototype front mounting storage rack and pannier that I had loaded up with about 5 kg of groceries.  
 
 
 

We are working hard to meet these specifications as we begin production.  As we are in final prototype state, some of these specs might change slightly.

Frame and fork 6061 aluminum
Motor 250-watt geared brushless
Battery 36V 10Ah lithium
Length 114cm
Size, compacted 109cm x 30cm x 79cm
Weight 15.4 kg
Distance per charge 30 km (approx. 5 cents electricity)
Max speed 25km/h
Wheel size 20” front x 16” back
 

We have been refining our production prototype since the concept was first conceived 2 years ago.  We have tested the prototypes on over 170 riders ranging in age from 16 to 74 (see our Facebook fan page for the Test Riders gallery https://www.facebook.com/ReveloElectric).  Everyone was able to ride successfully on their very first try.
The design intent of the LIFEbike was to make it easy to maintain, easy to ride, great looking, lightweight, strong, safe, and contain common parts that are easy to replace. From our prototypes, we have completed our first manufacturing 3D model and have located a bike manufacturer in Canada to work with us.  
The first prototypes were hand-built by Henry and we look forward to putting the first manufactured prototypes through rigorous testing this summer.
The costs to get us to production are extensive and this is where we need your help. We are aiming to get the first limited edition LIFEbikes out this September.
Whenever Henry rides the LIFEbike, people always stop him and ask, "That's cool! Where can I get one?" With your help, we can complete the testing of our final prototypes and get them in the hands of happy riders like you very soon!
 

Your support is very much appreciated!!  These rewards have been developed with style and functionality in mind.
For $10, a Revelo reflective strip to wrap around your leg or arm for added safety.
For $15, a Revelo drawstring pack + Revelo reflective strip

For $40, Revelo Original Tee + Revelo drawstring pack + Revelo reflective strip:

For $60, Revelo Original Hoodie + Drawstring Pack + Reflective Strip: 

For $120, Fun and Freedom for a Day use of LIFEbike for two (available for Toronto region only)
For $200, Customize Your LIFEbike with choice of color

For $400, Layaway for General Availability LIFEbike + Tee
For $1500, Production Run LIFEbike.  Available November 2013.
For $1,800, Limited Edition LIFEbike. Early release and individually numbered. Ready Sept 2013.
For $2600, A pair of Production Run LIFEbikes to double the fun.  Available November 2013. 
All LIFEbikes will be backed by a 2 year warranty on parts and materials, and 1 year battery warranty.  Destination based delivery charge will apply at time of delivery. 
 

We are a team with a mission to revolutionize personal transportation with clean and efficient electric transportation alternatives that give people more fun and freedom.  We hope game changing designs like our LIFEbike will encourage more people to adopt greener modes of transportation, thus helping relieve our cities of congestion and empowering them to better explore and connect with their surroundings.

From Henry:
My passion lies within the intersection of human interaction, mobility systems and urban development.  With the emergence of the electric bike technology, I became a strong proponent of electric bikes as an immediately available, green and sustainable transportation option, especially for urban environments.
After a 20-year career in Information Technology, I decided to pursue my true passion to become an Industrial Designer and completed my degree from OCADU in 2011.  As a 35-year bicycle enthusiast and urban commuter, I focused my thesis project on the transportation needs of the urban commuter and created the LIFEbike. 
Realizing how empowering LIFEbike can be for so many, I founded Revelo Bikes Inc. in 2012 with a mission to create innovative, fun and highly usable personal electric vehicles that inspire and empower others to live life more fully. 
As a child immigrant to Canada, I am especially proud to present the LIFEbike as a designed-in-Canada solution and can’t wait to watch it revolutionize urban commuting around the world.
Revelo Bikes Inc. is a new Canadian company dedicated to revolutionizing personal transportation and we have received generous support from MaRS, OCE, OCADU, and Venture Start to help guide us through our development.

 

For all our supporters, we would like to engage you for your input as we further develop the LIFEbike.  We’ve already received enquiries and interest for the LIFEbike from around the world and for all types of use. We’ve been asked by major academic and industrial campuses to offer the LIFEbike as a campus bike; we’ve been asked by seniors who see this as a manageable, trusted, personal transportation companion; busy families see this as an affordable "2nd car;" others with mobility and balance concerns have suggested a tricycle version of the LIFEbike. 
With your contribution, we invite you to add your voice to this conversation as there is much impact that the LIFEbike can make, to lives, to communities, and to cities. 
Together, we can help reduce congestion, encourage the use of a greener form of transportation, and empower individuals by providing greater personal mobility.
"Gas prices continue to rise and people are looking for alternative methods of transportation.  The world continues to become a green, sustainable society and the LIFEbike is a perfect fit -  The Crowdfund Mafia "
Thank you!
 
 
Questions or comments – if you have a question, just post it as a comment and we will respond to it promptly.
Please see the campaign Gallery for the most up to date answers to the FAQs.

story:
A new portable generator set that is very efficient, provides a constant source of electricity and consumes 10 times less fuel!

Electricity is an essential part of our lives which we cannot do without. Usually the source is from the grid! But what if there is a grid failure? Or no grid at all? There are many alternatives, from renewable sources such as sun and wind but MOST COMMONLY , used in 99% cases, is a GENERATOR.


Are there any enhancements possible to a Generator? YES, and quite dramatic! 


P-Gen is used as a constant source of electricity, no matter for what purpose. As a backup, or autonomous power supply, you will always have needed electricity at the lowest cost which is possible to achieve from a generator - even cheaper than from stationary big diesel generators, and sometimes the grid. Now you can power anything on the 24/7 basis, and do not worry about fuel, or generator maintenance. And if little electricity used - little gasoline consumed, no matter over what period of time.


А perk example


HOW MUCH IT WILL COST?

Normally it would retail for about 2000 USD.  But for the purpose of fundraising, we will ship it at a discounted price of 1450 USD  including international shipping (All additional taxation and local charges apply). The supplied version will include generator according to it's specifications. Additional features such as WiFi monitoring and UPS expansion will be included in 2000 USD perk and above. A WiFI and UPS features, could be purchased separately for about $100 and $700 accordingly. A 3G and MPPT solar controller will be available when we reach stretch goals. And if we don't reach stretch goals, they still will be available but with delay of about 6 months.

P-Gen working principle.


The basic principle, is that engine runs at full efficiency, which is at full power, and all the generated energy is stored in the Lithium battery. From there, DC current is converted by Inverter to AC current 110/230V.  Current is always present and stored energy used only as much as it is needed. Therefore, absolutely no fuel is wasted when there is low or no load at all, and we achieve nearly 100% fuel to electricity efficiency.

Due to a nature of electricity consumption, electrical appliances demand current at different rate. For example a washing machine, when it is in Stand-By consumes very little current, when it heats up water inside it might consume up to 5 kW but only for a short period of time, and in the working cycle it might demand from 0,2 to 1kW.

The Generator must maintain maximum current otherwise it will stall and to do this it uses fuel, which is being wasted as heat and exhaust. Rarely are you using all your devices at once. The normal overall load is about 0,1-0,3 kW, which is equivalent to a working TV, internet router and some lighting. Only when you prepare food, do your laundry or Hoover the house, the load is about 1-5 kW, but still for short periods of time 10-15 min, the rest of the time it is not more than 0,5 kW. Which means you need all generator's power for not more than 1 hour a day, the rest of the time you don't.

P-Gen ELIMINATES fuel consumption on the low load, which will save about 90% of the fuel, providing electricity 24/7 for household needs.  

Who we are & What we need?


Who we are

We at Pluspower team of dedicated engineers, specializing in cutting edge power electronics and innovative solutions for energy efficiency. We are full cycle engineering company, where we design our systems from physics and materials, to circuit boards and high/low level software. Our specialty is AC/DC and DC/AC converters, Lithium battery management systems (BMS), including large voltage and large capacity industrial batteries assembly and controllers which manage converters and BMS. We have over 10 patents on generator optimization systems and high frequency planar transformers, which allow us to build high power converters about 1/5 size of what available on the market, with efficiency of 97%-98%. 

Mostly, we do large optimization systems for villages which live off diesel generators. There are many isolated settlements in Siberia with about 100-300 inhabitants, where local "GRID" is powered by generator. Our systems reduce the amount of consumed fuel by about 2 times in the winter, the period of very high load, and  about 10 times in the summer.

When we have finished developing our latest and smallest version of 5 kW inverter (DC/AC converter), we thought, why cannot our technology be used on a small scale basis? There are millions of people out there, who don't have any electricity at all, or have suffered from natural disasters or just want to have cottage in the middle of nowhere. Why can't they have proper permanent supply of electricity, which would not consume much fuel and electricity cost would be not much more than off the grid, or even cheaper?

What we need?

We have finished developing all the "difficult" parts of the system: automatic engine control, permanent magnet alternator, active rectifier,  solid 70V 20Ah lithium battery, BMS for that battery, 5 kW inverter and controller with TFT display to manage all that.

The product contains some expensive parts, the inverter, Lithium battery, alternator, and engine. We are engineering and development company and we outsource our production. To obtain cost effective individually made parts, we must:

  1. Pay for production line setup at manufacturer.
  2. Place a quantity order to achieve a good price.

And that's where we need your help. If we get advance orders for the P-Gen, we will be able to make first mass series of it. And not just deliver it to our contributors, with this we can attract funding, establish production, and make P-Gen widely available.


Global impact

We are not just raising money for the commercial implementation of a good engineering idea but providing a much needed product with global demand.

Take a look at Earth at night Google maps . What do you see? Some would say "light pollution", well in some large cities this might be the case. However, from the electrification point of view, it would be clear, that only about 20% of the world has direct access to centralized electric grid. 

In South America, Africa, the Near and Middle East where there have been and are wars the infrastructure is totally destroyed. These are highly populated areas where people don't have a constant source of electricity. Additionally, where there natural disasters hundreds of thousands of people are left without electricity and homes.

There a many fund raising campaigns, where people gather money for humanitarian causes, like health, education, natural disaster aid. How is it possible to educate children for example, when you have electricity for only an hour or two a day? Or what kind of health aid there could be, if people simple don't have fridges or coolers to store medicine?

We are great believers in alternative power, we  have even added solar panels connection to P-Gen. But for now, the most accessible source of energy is Gasoline, and people use  it to make electricity. In a portable generator market 97% is made up of petrol driven generators. As this is the most popular source of portable electricity today, why not make it cheap,efficient and more ecological?

Every year about 15 million portable generator sets sold worldwide. All this adds to pollution and other sorts of ecological consequences, like engine oil spills. Let's make our contribution, and bring more efficient and cheap electricity, where it is now needed and while we wait for new sources of electric energy become worldwide available.

Stretch Goals:


Risks & Challenges

We have great experience in outsource production, as we have developed and manufactured our products for over 4 years now. We have established strong connections with some of the best (from our point of view) manufacturers in East Asia where main parts and electronics are manufactured.

Most of the electronic components we use, come from world leading manufacturers, such as STMicroelectronics, Cree, Infineon,  Magnetics, Kemet, United Chemi-Con etc. We aim at a world class product of the highest quality.

The key ingredient is the Lithium LiFePo4 battery which is custom made in Russia. One of the biggest industrial Lithium battery manufacturers in the World is a Russian company Liotech. In close collaboration with Liotech we have developed a custom 70V 20Ah battery, which will be produced specially for P-Gen. We are technical developer and producer of battery management systems (BMS) for their batteries.

    Lithium battery prototype.

    In our campaign, we are being realistic, and give terms in which we will definitely accomplish production and be able to ship P-Gen to our contributors.

    We are professional engineering company, and always stand behind our words and promises. If we fail to ship P-Gen before August 2015, we will make a full refund (less commissions) to anyone who will ask for it and has contributed 1450 USD and above.

    To keep you up to date, we will post at least 3 updates a week on our manufacturing progress and once a week new photos of developed parts, serial prototypes and software. Also we will answer all incoming questions, and post additional Q&A if they arise.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can contribute not with money but with an act, that will be valued. If you can spread the word, re-post or promote our campaign in any way, you are most welcome. This would be remunerated on a commercial basis, see our Referral Contest.

    Participate in our Referral Contest!

    Refer as many friends as you can, When their contribution reaches $1000, you get a $200 discount on P-Gen.
    When amount of contributions on your behalf reaches $2500, you get a $500 discount on P-Gen.
    As if contribution from your friends will go up to $9000, you get a new P-Gen  itself, and that includes international delivery! 

    Questions & Answers

    Q: What type of load can I connect to P-Gen

    A: Any type of load could be connected, provide it's starting currents are not higher 7000VA, which is nearly all household appliances.

    Q: How much gasoline it will use, if i use it 24/7 for my house.

    A: From our statistics, we know that on average, household consumes about 6-9 kWhours a day. Provided that power of engine is 3kW, it will work for about 1-3 hours a day, Which is about 1-3 liter of gasoline. BUT, if you use less electricity, the amount of gasoline consumed will be less accordingly.

    Q: Can I connect to P-Gen some sensitive equipment like computers, TV,       Hi-End music equipment etc.

    A: YES. P-Gen generates absolutely sinusoidal voltage, with nearly absence of any distortions. The quality of generated electricity exceeds the quality you get off the grid, therefore any sensitive electronics could be powered.

    Q: Can I use it for commercial purposes? To power my shop for example.

    A: If your commercial consumer, will consume within 12  kWhours of electricity a day, then it is no problem. This product designed for household usage, and it is not intended for commercial consumers. BUT, you can parallel few P-Gens to increase total output, and daily electricity consumption.

    Q: Can I leave P-Gen working unattended for long time?

    A: Yes, you can. If total electricity consumption over long period of time, within the capacity of tank, which is 25 liters, or about 83 kWhours. If P-Gen runs out of gasoline, it will automatically switch off. 

    Q: Is there a remote control possibility?

    A: Yes, if you have Wi-Fi,  the remote control and monitoring is possible, where you can keep track of it's current state. If you don't have Wi-Fi Internet, there is a 3G modem option, which reveals full remote administration potential, indeed with mobile networks present. A convenient iOS, Android and Windows, monitoring software will be available.

    Q: How do I control P-Gen remotely?

    A: There are 3 way to do it. 1) you make P-Gen a hotpoint, and connect to it directly via Wi-Fi. 2) P-Gen connects to your Wi-Fi router and you connect to it via Internet/Intranet. 3) Using a 3G module, you can connect to it via mobile Internet. Though you must have a separate SIM card for P-Gen. P-Gen has a 128bit encryption and proprietary communication protocol, which will secure your save connection.

    Q: Is there any additional control functions of P-Gen

    A: Yes. Scheduler will allow to set precise time when P-Gen outputs power, so you can plan any remote powering strategy. With installation of UPS module, you can plan when and how much energy must be consumed from the grind,  when to charge and discharge battery, and presence of solar module will expand scheduling possibilities even further. We will provide a full update on the new features.

    Q: Can I use it as UPS?

    A: YES. With addition of UPS module (will retail for about 700USD), P-Gen will become On-Line 5kVA UPS. You don't need ATS or anything else. While grid is present, electricity will be supplied from there, when grid goes down, engine will be used to power your needs.

    Q: I would like to use photo-voltaic solar panels to reduce fuel consumption.

    A: With addition of MPPT solar module (will retail for about 400 USD), which fits inside the enclosure, You can connect up to 4 X 300W photo-voltaic panels. P-Gen has built in 1,2kWh Lithium battery, and inverter. System will preliminary use the energy from panels, and switching engine only in case of solar power shortage. If you live in sunny region, an additional battery could be installed (also fits inside), to increase solar energy storage.

    Q: How save is P-Gen?

    A: P-Gen absolutely safe. All parts are manufactured from nonflammable materials. There are several internal fuses to protect battery from short circuit. Lithium battery is equipped with sophisticated active battery management system, which prevents it from overcharging. Battery does not burn, explode, produce Hydrogen or any harmful gases. Output has full galvanic isolation, therefore it could be earthed and RCD installed at consumer side for additional safety. At the end of lifetime it could be utilised as standard electronics. LiFePo4 battery does not require special utilisation as it is a household class rubbish.

    Q: How do I maintain it?

    A: P-Gen will inform you when and what to do. Usually it will be filter and oil change, which is not a big trouble. There are no serviceable parts inside except engine. Used engine will be a mass market engine from one of the popular and reliable manufacturers. Therefore you can service it in any motor shop. Although all P-Gens will undergo stress tests, if it fails in the warranty period, and the problem could not be solved though our resolution center, we will ship new spare parts or generator itself. And indeed we will work for internations partnership with servece centers for a better convenience of our customers.

Questions & Answers
Q: What type of load can I connect to P-Gen
A: Any type of load could be connected, provide it's starting currents are not higher 7000VA, which is nearly all household appliances.
Q: How much gasoline it will use, if i use it 24/7 for my house.
A: From our statistics, we know that on average, household consumes about 6-9 kWhours a day. Provided that power of engine is 3kW, it will work for about 1-3 hours a day, Which is about 1-3 liter of gasoline. BUT, if you use less electricity, the amount of gasoline consumed will be less accordingly.
Q: Can I connect to P-Gen some sensitive equipment like computers, TV,       Hi-End music equipment etc.
A: YES. P-Gen generates absolutely sinusoidal voltage, with nearly absence of any distortions. The quality of generated electricity exceeds the quality you get off the grid, therefore any sensitive electronics could be powered.
Q: Can I use it for commercial purposes? To power my shop for example.
A: If your commercial consumer, will consume within 12  kWhours of electricity a day, then it is no problem. This product designed for household usage, and it is not intended for commercial consumers. BUT, you can parallel few P-Gens to increase total output, and daily electricity consumption.
Q: Can I leave P-Gen working unattended for long time?
A: Yes, you can. If total electricity consumption over long period of time, within the capacity of tank, which is 25 liters, or about 83 kWhours. If P-Gen runs out of gasoline, it will automatically switch off. 
Q: Is there a remote control possibility?
A: Yes, if you have Wi-Fi,  the remote control and monitoring is possible, where you can keep track of it's current state. If you don't have Wi-Fi Internet, there is a 3G modem option, which reveals full remote administration potential, indeed with mobile networks present. A convenient iOS, Android and Windows, monitoring software will be available.

Q: How do I control P-Gen remotely?
A: There are 3 way to do it. 1) you make P-Gen a hotpoint, and connect to it directly via Wi-Fi. 2) P-Gen connects to your Wi-Fi router and you connect to it via Internet/Intranet. 3) Using a 3G module, you can connect to it via mobile Internet. Though you must have a separate SIM card for P-Gen. P-Gen has a 128bit encryption and proprietary communication protocol, which will secure your save connection.
Q: Is there any additional control functions of P-Gen
A: Yes. Scheduler will allow to set precise time when P-Gen outputs power, so you can plan any remote powering strategy. With installation of UPS module, you can plan when and how much energy must be consumed from the grind,  when to charge and discharge battery, and presence of solar module will expand scheduling possibilities even further. We will provide a full update on the new features.
Q: Can I use it as UPS?
A: YES. With addition of UPS module (will retail for about 700USD), P-Gen will become On-Line 5kVA UPS. You don't need ATS or anything else. While grid is present, electricity will be supplied from there, when grid goes down, engine will be used to power your needs.
Q: I would like to use photo-voltaic solar panels to reduce fuel consumption.
A: With addition of MPPT solar module (will retail for about 400 USD), which fits inside the enclosure, You can connect up to 4 X 300W photo-voltaic panels. P-Gen has built in 1,2kWh Lithium battery, and inverter. System will preliminary use the energy from panels, and switching engine only in case of solar power shortage. If you live in sunny region, an additional battery could be installed (also fits inside), to increase solar energy storage.
Q: How save is P-Gen?
A: P-Gen absolutely safe. All parts are manufactured from nonflammable materials. There are several internal fuses to protect battery from short circuit. Lithium battery is equipped with sophisticated active battery management system, which prevents it from overcharging. Battery does not burn, explode, produce Hydrogen or any harmful gases. Output has full galvanic isolation, therefore it could be earthed and RCD installed at consumer side for additional safety. At the end of lifetime it could be utilised as standard electronics. LiFePo4 battery does not require special utilisation as it is a household class rubbish.

Q: How do I maintain it?
A: P-Gen will inform you when and what to do. Usually it will be filter and oil change, which is not a big trouble. There are no serviceable parts inside except engine. Used engine will be a mass market engine from one of the popular and reliable manufacturers. Therefore you can service it in any motor shop. Although all P-Gens will undergo stress tests, if it fails in the warranty period, and the problem could not be solved though our resolution center, we will ship new spare parts or generator itself. And indeed we will work for internations partnership with servece centers for a better convenience of our customers.

story:
So here's the new situation...

Due to various extenuating circumstances regarding family, finances, and the such I'm not going to be able to go surprise my girlfriend Brooke in Michigan during spring break. Frowntown.
However, she is coming here to visit this winter, Christmas to be exact! I want to show her what makes the Pacific Northwest and Bellingham so awesome! But I'm broke and in college, and after just kicking a 2 month bout with mono I haven't been able to save much money for adventures for when she comes...

So if you want to chip in for fun adventures like:
  • A nice date night or two ($50)
  • A weekend trip maybe to a bed and breakfast in the San Juan islands? ($200)
  • A day adventure to Vancouver, BC - she's never been to an aquarium! ($50)
  • Some gas $ to take her up to Mt. Baker for some snowshoeing fun ($40)
  • And maybe take her out to a few of the can't miss food places in Bellingham like Boomer's, Fiamma, La Fienne's... the good stuff! ($50)
Then that would be awesome! $550 is a bit much, since originally I was trying to get a plane ticket... So anything that is contributed I promise will be put to good use showing her around this beautiful area! :)
Thank you so much for your generosity, and happy holidays y'all!

story:
The Spina Bifida & Hydrocephalus Association of Northern Alberta (SBHANA) was formed in 1981 to meet the needs of families and individuals affected by spina bifida, and since then has continued to grow. Our mission statement is to improve the quality of life for people affected by spina bifida and hydrocephalus through advocacy, education, research, and support.

On June 29th, 2013, we will be hosting the Skate for Spina Bifida & Hydrocephalus and Wheel Around with Wheelz workshop. Aaron ‘Wheelz’ Fotheringham will be our honoured guest; as the first individual to do a double backflip in a wheelchair, he is an inspiration to people across the world, including our members. Aaron is from the USA, and bringing him to Canada will create an amazing opportunity for our local members to learn from him about adapted activities such as hardcore sitting (wheelchair skate-boarding, essentially).

To fund this amazing endeavour, we need $5000. This money will cover Aaron’s fees, flights, food, and accommodations. As he will be not only running a workshop, but also a demonstration, our event will be open to members of our organization as well as the general public. After his demo, there will be a skate competition to raise funds for SBHANA. Registrants will have access to a wonderful array of goodies including free t-shirts, apparel, skate decks, and gift cards! Should we not meet our entire goal, the funds we do raise will still be used to cover as much of Aaron’s fees, flights, etc. as possible.

Adapted activities are fantastic opportunities for our members to get active. Recreational activities and exercise are two extremely important parts of daily living, and Aaron’s demonstration and workshop will seamlessly blend the two. Having a “big name” such as Aaron attend our event will also raise public awareness of hardcore sitting as well as spina bifida & hydrocephalus. We are currently gathering interest in our event through a raffle run in conjunction with the skate competition and workshop, and we are pursuing media coverage. In the past, our organization has had extreme success in activities such as this one. Our yearly Hope Classic Run/Walk/Wheel event is one such example of this. For the past five years, the Hope Classic has been one of our largest fundraisers, bringing in over $20,000 and 150 participants in 2012. With such success in that event, we feel we can apply that same energy to this event and make it an epic day!

There are many ways you can contribute! If you have some spare change, please feel free to donate it. If you have a spare moment, you can get the word out and make some noise for our campaign! Remember to utilize the Indiegogo share tools.

Help make our dream come true and positively impact the lives of Edmontonians and SBHANA members!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, My Name is Rory Watson.

I am a passionate Yes Supporter and I run a Pro-Independence Online Radio Station. I believe strongly in an Independent Scotland, and I play my part by joining campaigns such as RIC and Yes Groups to attend leafleting and canvassing sessions.

In all my spare time, I enjoy to campaign outdoors and via Social Media for the Yes Vote in September. I have been doing this since being introduced to the Yes side by my family almost two years ago.

My campaign is called "1000 Car Stickers For Yes" and it's a campaign with the aim to get as many Yes Scotland Car Stickers into Car Windows around Scotland as possible, the minimum being 1000. I have recently taken inspiration from the "10,000 Flags For Yes" Campaign which recently met its goal, and was a fantastic success.

I believe that car stickers are a fantastic way of getting the Yes message out. You may not think it, but 100's of people will see the average car window sticker every day, from being on the road to having your car parked in shopping centres etc.

Car stickers are a brilliant way to spread the message, and the impact of 1000's around Scotland will be fantastic, giving out the message that Scotland can be an Independent Nation - coupled with the Yes Scotland website, which gives people the opportunity to find out more and get involved.

We can't just rely on local campaign groups and the billboard ad's to do the job; as a collective we can make a massive impact to the quest to become our own country.

By contributing to this campaign, you can make a real difference to the success of "Yes" and advertise the Yes Scotland via your car window. All it takes is a small donation via PayPal or Card and you have your very own Car Sticker...

Thank you for reading this so far, I have included more detailed info below if you are interested in contributing to the success of "1000 Car Stickers For Yes".

What We Need & What You Get

Our initial goal is £1000 - which is enough for us to supply 1000 Yes Scotland Car Stickers, if the campaign is extremely popular, the goal will be extended to suit the demand of stickers.

We ask that for one car sticker, you donate £1. This one pound will cover the £0.40 cost of a Sticker, the 9% IndieGogo Fee and the cost of Postage (from Yes Scotland, and the cost of a 2nd Class Stamp from me to you). As you can see, no profit will be made from this campaign - it is simply one aim to get the Yes Campaign noticed on the roads.

 For donations over £1, such as £5, £10, £20 etc will get you up to 20 Car Stickers depending on how much you donate. If you wish to only receive a certain amount of car stickers which is less than the allocated from your donation, please let me know by either Commenting or Emailing me at youyesyetindy@gmail.com.

The perks are simply a Car Sticker, which will come in a standard envelope addressed to the shipping address you provide us with.

Even if we do not reach our goal, the campaign will still go ahead and you will receive your car sticker.

 

 

The Impact

Imagine driving along the motorway and the car in front of you has a Yes Car Sticker, imagine going to the shopping centre and passing multiple cars in the car park with Yes Sticker... the impact from people seeing your sticker will be momentous.

With less than 4 months to go, we can really the Yes message out there and show people that Scotland supports an Independent Scotland.

This will not only be a good advert to Undecided/No's but a morale boost to fellow Yes voters, who will be delighted to see another supporter of the Yes campaign, you may even get chatting with each other about the campaign.

So let's make it happen, we have 35 days to get 1000 Yes Stickers out into your own, friends and families car windows and advertise the message of Yes.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't financially contribute to the "1000 Car Stickers For Yes" campaign, it doesn't mean you can't make a difference. Share us with your friends and family, via Yes Groups, Social Media sites and by using the IndieGogo Sharing tools... a share is just as good as a purchase!

 

Once again, thanks for reading my pitch and I hope you will be able to contribute to the success of 1000 Car Stickers For Yes.

Here's to a fantastic summer of Yes, and a win in September.

Many Thanks,

Rory Watson

18.9 Indy Scot Radio & 1000 Car Stickers For Yes.

story:
Update: Order your EyeDrive on our official website by following this link: https://eye-lights.com/pages/eyedrive​ Shipping has already started! Discover customers feedbacks on the "Update Page"

Any question?  Contact us on Facebook or at crowdfunding@eye-lights.fr

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

When your smartphone is on your dashboard, you're still tempted to pick it up or look at it, while driving. 

EyeDrive offers a safe way to get information from your phone apps while driving and without endangering yourself and others.

 

 

 

EyeDrive allows you to display your favorite navigation app, directly on your windshield.  

Enter your desired address on our app, Waze or Google Maps. Get the best route and follow it without taking your eyes off the road.

Our transmissive technology provides the biggest virtual image you can get on the market. 

 
 

 

 

 

 

 

 
 

 

EyeDrive Gesture Control© is a truly intuitive wireless technology. Our gesture sensor uses infrared technology to detect your hand movements and launch different actions.

Use natural swipes to accept/decline a call, manage your music or launch our backup camera.

 

 

 

 

 

 

EyeDrive integrates a rearview camera compatible with any car. Enjoy a perfectly clear and lag-free image displayed on your windshield.

Easy to install. Waterproof. Wireless.  5 times cheaper than a built-in option.

No need to drill any holes or to root cable into your car. Just peel off the sticker and stick it to where you want it to be installed. 

The camera is equipped with a removable battery. Easy to remove and reload.

 

 

Our display is fully transparent, which means there is nothing to block your view. 

It takes on average 3 minutes to get used to the technology. Access the information 10 times faster* than your phone.

 

*According to public safety organization, you lose 5s of attention due to the smartphone use while driving. Head Up Displays reduces that to 0.5s means you get the information 10 times faster.

 

They already received their EyeDrive. 

 
 

 

 

 

 

Choose your new experience.

 

For the first time: The Best Automotive Technology at an affordable price. 

 

EyeDrive is a high-quality, premium-design hardware device, operating holographic display. A unique optical combination that brings 10 times brighter images than your iPad.

What competitors offer V.S What EyeDrive offers.

 

EyeDrive was created for any car in the market, no matter what you're driving.

The EyeDrive display is 10 times brighter than other solutions (4000 nits). Thanks to its brightness sensor, EyeDrive's display screen is clear under any lighting, even on those really sunny days or during the night.

 

 Our magnetic secure-fit technology allows no vibration on the device and a simple way to remove the device when you leave the car.

 

Don't waste Time. Set-up in seconds.

 

 

 

 

 

 

We are proud of EyeDrive because it truly brings a safe alternative to smartphone use. This product gives you an all-new driving experience! We are a team of former automotive optical doctors and engineers with one mission: deliver the best driving experience.

We already have experience bringing products to market, having launched our cutting edge AR tech for motorcyclists a year ago. We came up with the idea to make Fighter Pilot Head-Up Display technology affordable to anyone.

We sold thousands of them and had a huge demand from our customers to make a car product so we decided to expand our technology with the same logic: making it work for any cars.

We've been using feedbacks collected from our beta testers community, to improve the product design (including hardware and software) for the final version.

story:
Even before they were exploding, existing hoverboards didn’t satisfy our need for a premium, self-balancing scooter that was fun to ride. We designed MOOV from the ground up with the priority of buying safe and reliable parts from America. We’re proud to say that our product is designed and hand-built here in the USA.

We control every aspect of product quality to ensure the highest level of safety and reliability. Our engineers inspect and test every battery and board that leaves our facility in Dallas. Starting with UL Certification, the MOOV will be fully compliant and tested to the highest hoverboard standard, UL2272, as well as the Department of Transportation’s battery-specific standard, UN38.3.  So you can rest easy that this board is safe, reliable, and most of all fun.  

Feel turns and enjoy a thrilling experience at all skill levels. Our proprietary technology and dynamic ride profiles create an enhanced riding experience like you've never felt before.

MOOV is the first of its kind to utilize a solid platform design with steering control based on weight rather than foot angle.  This makes the board feel much more sporty and fun than traditional hoverboards. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

   

  

  

  

 

 

                      

 

 

  

 

 

 

RADICAL TRANSPORT - DALLAS, TX At Radical Transport, we are defining a new direction in personal transportation. We exist to reinvent the personal electric transport category. Radical was founded out of our passion for making cool things that move…and move the needle. We believe that wheels are more than just getting from point A to point B. They should be well crafted and safe. Most of all, they should be fun. Join the MOOVMENT.

 

 

Check out the links below for even more cool material on the MOOV.  Feel free to reach out to us with any questions or comments too! 

www.instagram.com/radicaltransport

www.radicalmoov.us

www.facebook.com/radicaltransport

    

_

story:
Undistracted Pleasure. This is what SpeedX Leopard is all about. Riding is an activity that touches people’s mind. Riders want to be integrated with the bike, in each own rhythm, in fluency, without distraction. Leopard is ready to give the rider the ultimate road experience.


Built with aesthetics and performance in mind.The Leopard will surpass your every riding need: whether for intense training and competition or a Sunday spin with friends, it offers unparalleled comfort and enjoyment.



More than a year ago we set ourselves an incredible mission. We wanted to combine carbon fiber and technology in a bike in an aerodynamic way like never done before. After 1560 sketches, 12 different prototypes and one year of our time we present you: The SpeedX Leopard.


Imagine a bike with a brain – taking care of everything except the cycling. That’s just what we made SpeedX Smart Control to do. It records your ride data and provides you with professional analysis in real-time with its built-in 2.4” inch screen. We designed XCoach specifically to prepare professional training courses – with interesting tasks and challenges, as well as global ranking tables.

  • RECORDS 12 TYPES OF CYCLING DATA 

Connect with SpeedX Smart Control with any ANT+ compatible device. Our bike has built-in sensors, we measure your performance based on the following 12 points:

 
  • 800KM ULTRA-LONG BATTERY LIFE

With our innovative low-power GPS system our Smart Control can track and record your data for up to 800km or 40 hours. It only takes up to 30 minutes for a full charge. 



Together with FIBERTEK®, we developed proprietary methods and technologies to stack the T1000 military-grade carbon fiber. Every bike frame stacks 207 folded layers, which ultimately leads to a phenomenally light 1.2kg frame. It weighs in at a mere half of a normal bike, thanks to its carbon-fiber frame, front fork, and seat post.


We knew the SpeedX frame just had to use single-piece technology for better stress distribution performance. Our efforts were rewarded with front-fork comfort that beats many of the world’s leading bike frames.We subject a new bike to nearly 300 production and testing processes, including stiffness testing on key frame parts to ensure the bike’s stiffness.


We’ve improved both aesthetics and performance by cleverly hiding the brake cables in the front fork, reducing air resistance and maximising style.


SpeedX is the third bicycle brand in the world to achieve full-integrated wiring. The other two bicycles with full-integrated wiring cost considerably more - $5999 (TREK Madone 9.2) and $8200 (Specialized Venge Pro ViAS).

After more than eight months of prototyping the brakes, we found that the most aerodynamic way is putting the brakes behind the front fork.

We’ve hidden the brake behind the front fork, making it look more aerodynamic than ever.


The Leopard boasts a simple, sleek look, matched only by the excellence of its riding experience. We thought long and hard about our choice of a race-ready SHIMANO 105 drivetrain, TRP fully internal brakes and a T1000 carbon fiber frame, front fork and seatpost.

The Leopard will surpass your every riding need: whether for intense training and competition or a Sunday spin with friends, it offers unparalleled comfort and enjoyment. 


We believe in our bike and you should too. We offer lifetime replacement warranty for the bikeframe. Ride in more comfort knowing that we that we have your back!

Every SpeedX customer enjoys a 7 days-no-questions-asked return and 30 days free exchange. Ride in even more comfort knowing that the SpeedX comes with a lifetime frame replacement guarantee.  


We’ve created a unique Smart Bike Fitting System to provide every rider with the best possible bike-fit. Just take a photo and upload it – the Smart Bike Fitting System will do the rest for you, automatically selecting the most suitable model, frame, handle bars and stem. Everything can be handled by the SpeedX Smart Bike Fitting System – no more worrying about which size is right for you. 

Need more power? Our Leopard Pro is designed to give the amateur riders the ultimate road experience. 

  • Shimano Ultegra Di2 
  • Carbon Fiber aero wheels
  • Carbon Fiber handle bar
  • fi'zi:k R7 Road Saddle
  • Total Weight 7.9kg


Our team of more than 50 people from all different backgrounds have one thing in common: we love cycling.

SpeedX is setting out to become a global smart-sport brand through design and first-class technology. It is SpeedX goal to offer all customers a brand new way of performing sports. Through the advanced technology of combining hardware and software, SpeedX is transforming the old way of riding a bicycle to a new and modern activity.

FAQ

Is VAT and duty included in the price?

VAT and duty is not included in the price. 

How do I know what size I need to choose?

We'll send a survey every month. This also includes a link to our bike fitting system, that measures which size you have. 

What groupset do you use on the Leopard/Pro?

We use Shimano 105 on Leopard and UT Di2 on Leopard Pro.

What kind of carbon fiber do we use on bike frame of Leopard and Leopard Pro?

We used Toray T1000 to build the bike frames of Leopard and Leopard Pro.

What are specs of display?

The display is 2.4 inch with 320x240 resolution, and the brightness sensor can make display adjust brightness automatically.

How do sensors connect to cycling computer?

Sensors can connect to our cycling computer on ANT+, which is including pedal sensor, speed sensor, HRM and power meter.

Does GPS come with the cycling computer?

Yes, you can plan your own cycling routes with real-time turn-by-turn navigation using the smart control.

Is it possible to customize a bike, i.e. upgrade some components?

We currently don’t provide this option.

How does the battery recharge?

In order to recharge your bike, you need to take the seat post off or charge it directly through the dock at behind of the seat post, and it can be charged with a micro USB cable.

What is the maximum allowed rider weight of the bike?

120kg.

What are the lifetime warranty covered?

Bike frame (top/down tube, chain/seat stay and seat tube) and fork.

How can I contact SpeedX?

If you have questions including tech questions, business co-operation, media interview and more, please send an email to support@speedx.com

story:
Who am I

My name is Eugene Mizin and I created this fundraising page for people who know me and want to support my participation in the Techbikers initiative.

What is Techbikers

I loved this idea from the start - people working at startups and generally in tech getting together to ride bikes for 3 days, network, and support a good cause.  As someone who sits at his desk in front of a computer most of the time, I could relate to the urge to get outside, so I decided to join.

The ride is a 350km 3-day endurance challenge that will start in Prague and end in Berlin.  More details here: http://techbikers.de/the-ride/

The goal is to raise money for the awesome charity dotHIV, which is building a crowdfunding platform to fight AIDS/HIV. 

Also, we raise money to cover a part of the rather high logistics costs of the ride.

A post about Techbikers: http://siliconallee.com/silicon-allee/startups/2013/06/11/techbikers-prague-trip-helping-a-wheel-y-good-cause-in-dothiv

Follow Techbikers on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/techbikers.de

How you can help 

You can help in one of the three ways:

1) Contribute to the charity that Techbikers selected: dotHIV.  To do so, please contribute on this page: https://www.betterplace.org/en/fundraising-events/techbikers-eugene

2) Contribute to the costs of my participation in the ride.  The logistics costs include bike rentals, hotel accomodations, special people that will make sure we are safe on the road, etc.  To support my participation in the ride, make a contribution here, on this page.

3) Via email or in the comments section, share your advice on how to best prepare for the 3-day ride.  Any pointers will be much appreciated!

story:
Intro

I am making a 39.75" x 10" longboard that folds up. As part of my project, I am also making a Quick Release Kingpin (see pic below).  So if it seems as though we are doing two products in one, We are! This board fits into all kinds of lockers, laptop backpacks, bear caves, and people's hearts with room to spare.  If our goal number seems low to you, we are not crazy.  Please read our goals section for the details.

Board Folded Inside Locker

WARNING: If you get this board, people will stop you to ask you about it.

Storytime

One day my brother that was visiting from California decided he wanted a board to ride on while at his college campus out in Ca. While, he loved the smoother ride of a longboard, he claimed he just had no where to stash it during class.  So, he got a frankenstein (shortboard w/ longboard wheels and trucks) instead.

In that moment, it became clear that while I love carrying my giant longboard into class, not eveyone does.  So, this board was designed for him.  He loved it. Then, I wanted to have one. I loved it. And now, I want to share it with everyone. You will love it.

Benefits

Kingpin

I have designed a fun quick release kingpin.  While these Quick Release Kingpins are an essential part of our Urban Sloop board, they are also quite handy on just about any board.  They are especially useful on mini cruisers 'cause they are often the difference that allows you to actually zip your backpack. 

Quick Release Kingpin

  

1) STORAGE - Whether on Mini cruisers, Sloops, or just regular longboards, quick release kingpins allow riders to remove their hangers which makes storing boards easier.  

2) TENSION - Our specialized kingpins allow you to adjust the tension on your bushings anywhere without tools.

Quick Release Specialized Kingpin

3) HANGER FLIP - When you don't need a tool, You can flip your hanger at any time.  

4) HANGER SWITCH - with hangers this easy to remove you can just take an extra set of hangers with a different length or wheel set-up around with you.  That way you can switch from hard sliding wheels to soft cruising wheels in a snap.

Board

It is important to remember that this board is meant to be a different kind of board.  This board is not simply a longboard that folds.  It is its own creature - with its own maneuvers and feel.

1) GREAT RIDE - People love the flex and the feel of this deck.  You can not get this kind of feel on a 1 piece deck and definitely not on a little plastic board.

2) SIZE MATTERS - This board can be stowed many places by folding it with the wheels still attached.  It can be stored almost anywhere (including most backpacks) when the wheels are removed.

3) SECURITY - The number one reason that people I know used to ride longboards but then stopped, "My board was stolen."  Storing a board isn't just about convenience, it is about security too.

4) DIFFERENT MANEUVERS - You can do things on this deck that you can not on a 1 piece deck.

Goal

My goal has always been to get at least 50 of these boards out to the public. To make it to this point, I have had to work in my backyard and, call in many favors from friends and family.  To make this project go to the next level, I need some support from everyone out there. Hopefully, through the miracle of indiegogo, we can do it. $5,000 Total is the initial goal.

Due to the timing of our project, we are dividing our fundraising efforts into two parts.  The first part will end on December 7th so that we can deliver our prototype backer benefits in time for the Holiday season.  Then, we will immediately repost the project to gather the remaining amount.

Bottom View

Stretch Goals

10K -All boards will have Indiegogo # laser etched on their board

20K -Aluminum support Plates become available

40K - Screws passing through metal plates will be countersunk

60K - Drop-thru model will become available

80K - Center Handle will be contoured to fit a hand

100K - Metal will be recessed to be flush with wood

120K - ???

By the stretch goals set, you can probably tell that we have some big plans in store for our board design.  While monetary goals are cool, the real goal here is to get some nasty boards to the people that want them.  The attainment of our stretch goals will be based on the total amount raised in both fundraising efforts.

 

Allocation of Funds

The majority of money will go towards parts and labor.  However, there are many other expenses to be considered.  Some of the money will go toward the costly patenting process.  Depending on the final number of backers, some money may need to go toward getting a new worksite.  If any funds are left over after those are covered, I would like to invest it in the website.

 

Note

The warning at the top is not a joke.  Whenever I ride my board, people ask me all kinds of questions.  So, if you get this board be prepared to talk to strangers.  Also not a joke - don't take their candy.

Thanks To:

My Fam - for being everything from crash test dummies, to artist, and doing it all with patientience

Allison - The loving Girl Friend that shows her support in her own special way. Like so quickly volunteering to write the "Don't Encourage Him" cards.

Nice Lady (a.k.a. Cassie from beastink) - for doing some sick designs

Dee of deenuncio.com - for being so crazy asiany & for great advice on all things digital marketing

Jimmy from Locals Surf Shop - Juno Beach

Raina, Peter, and Crew from Freeride Surf Shop - Gainesville, FL

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

Risks

I have recently started making my own sushi. I suppose one time it could go poorly and put me in the hospital. Or, one of the Kardashians could run for President. Let it sink in...terrifying. So, it seems as though there are quite a few risks in the world out there.

But, barring a zombie apocalypse - the primary risk is manufacturing.

Manufacturing

Some parts of the project will be manufactured by 3rd parties and negotiating prices and timelines tends to take awhile. However, I have had preliminary conversations with reputable manufacturers already.

Other parts will be assembled by our crew. The number of Backers that decide they want to support us will dictate if our current facility is big enough or, if we need to move to another one. But, I have already begun addressing this issue as well - just in case everyone in the world wants to be part of our project.

While these are legitimate challenges, I have come to take pride in being able to address issues as they arise. It is what makes this crazy process so rewarding. It should be said that the challenge here is more about hitting our goals on time not so much about hiting the goals in general.

The last, and scariest, risk is that not enough people will back the project. I say it is the scariest risk because it is the one that I have the least control over. The only way to overcome that risk is for you to let everyone know about our project. By the way, this board would be crazy handy in a zombie apocalypse - just sayin.

 

Thanks!

story:
Square Wave Racing (SWR) needs your help getting to the first TTXGP Zero Emission motorcycle race for 2010!

SWR developed a powerful and competitive electric motorcycle hand-fabricated from a local garage. The team is a true motley crew formed for two reasons only….. promote the electric revolution and win TTXGP races! We need your help though. We are looking for any help or assistance with transportation and shipping costs to get all the way from Columbus, Ohio to the Infineon Raceway in California.

SWR is a partnership between fabricator/team principal John Wild and Sean C. Ewing and Jordan Rhyne of Rhyne Electric Powersports (REP). This partnership was formed to design, build and race an electric motorcycle.

For us, electric vehicles are the future. Electricity from the grid is generated at tightly regulated power plants in large quantities. It is produced more cleanly and efficiently than power produced by a gasoline burning engine. There are zero emissions from the electric vehicle itself. Electric vehicles are quiet, which is a pleasant feature as our world becomes more crowded

Those are the official reasons for going electric racing. For us there are other reasons that are more exciting.

Super bike and MotoGP racing use motorcycle designs that have been refined for decades. The rule books enforce a uniformity of pattern that benefits the established motorcycle producers but slows improvement and keeps the cost of development REALLY high. Essentially, only the factory teams have the ability to spend enough money to make the tiny, subtle improvements that make a bike lead the points for a season. If the rules would allow free development motorcycles might begin to look different and change in unexpected ways.

The organizers of the TTXGP have designed their rules to encourage creativity and unconventional thinking, which is very attractive to Rhyne Electric Powersports and SWR. We want to try new ideas, not just polish the well tested and proven ones. We believe that we can imagine solutions to the problems that limit electric vehicles and advance the state of the art very quickly. Also, because the state of the art is currently rather crude, significant improvements can be made for relatively little cost. This is the first year for electric motorcycle racing in North America. We only began our collaboration in February of this year, so making the first races with our donated motorcycle chassis will be a tremendous achievement.
